With this camera, it is much more clearly apparent which mode you have chosen and the preview mode has its own little button.4.  4X zoom is better than the older 3X.5.  The optical viewfinder is a must and I would never recommend buying a camera without one.  If you are so inclined, wait until you are out in the bright sun and cannot see the screen.6.  Small, sleek and fits anywhere.On the down side:1.  It is a little slow at times, especially when saving the picture.In all, a good choice.  Why pay much more if you are looking for a familty-type use camera?  We are happy with the performance of these Canon products and highly recommend them

Reviews.Title: Low picture quality
Reviews.Author: Kristi M. Myers
Reviews.Content: I have a PowerShot A520 and wanted to upgrade.  Needless to say, I sent this camera back and went back to using my old camera.  This camera left half of my pictures blury and grainy.  I am used to using a Powershot and was really surprised when I saw how this one took pictures.  The pictures were terrible.  I took some more with my old camera and had them printed at the same time and the same place to make sure and it was this camera that did so poor.  Do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Lousy sensor.
Reviews.Author: Forrest Parker
Reviews.Content: I bought the 6.1MP version of this camera, and was thrilled.  The sensor on newer model, while having more megapixels, actually takes much worse pictures.  I haven't found a setting yet, even at very low  ISO's, that are not marred by grainy noise.  This appears to be a classic example of a manufacturer cramming in more megapixels, but having worse picture quality.I like a camera that uses AA batteries, but I'd avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Daniel P. DeMeyer
Reviews.Content: Love the fact that it has a viewfinder for taking shots in the bright sun.  Great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Dreaded Lens Error in less than 9 months~
Reviews.Author: Lisa J. Stadtmueller "Lisa@Handbags4Hunger"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: Camera broke after less than 9 months for no good reason. Just suddenly stopped working, giving the dreaded "lens error restart" message. BOO HISS! My new camera cost less and has worked longer and better. Shame on Canon for producing junk~!-----------------------------------------------------------This camera, the Canon PowerShot A1100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Silver) takes great pictures! And it's completely effortless. The 12.1 MP and 4x optical zoom PLUS optical image stabilizer is perfect if you have a shaky hand (as I do) and like to take candid shots without a tripod. And I love that this camera has "face detection" that can also be used WITH the self-timer so it waits for YOU to get in the picture before it focuses. Smart!The details are SO good I can print out large prints or make detailed images for my computer's desktop/display. NO pixels, very crisp.I have a wide-format printer (Canon Pixma Pro9000 Professional Large Format Inkjet Printer (9995A001)) and these look great at even the full size - 13 x 19 inches. Close-ups or distant shots come out equally sharp. I typically take a lot of shots of my kids close up and also beautiful landscapes when we go camping.I recently returned from such a trip and shared my photos on Facebook with another mom who had been there with us, who was using a professional camera like this: Nikon D90 DX 12.3MP Digital SLR Camera with 18-105mm f/3.5-5.6G ED AF-S VR DX Nikkor Zoom Lens - you know the kind with exchangeable lenses. Our shots are virtually indistinguishable. What more can you ask for!? She remarked at how good they are and even made one of them her new profile picture!In the past using my old camera, before my photos were "perfect" I would have to upload them to the computer and "FIX" them using photo retouching software - to make adjustments to brightness, contrast, shadows, highlights, temperature, tone, etc. NOW when try to do this using "Auto Adjust" NOTHING needs fixing! The pictures already have natural skin tones and backgrounds are bright enough.Another crazy good thing - anyone who's tried taking pictures of small kids knows how much they jump around when you're trying to get that perfect candid shot...OR if there's 2 in the picture and 1 more says "HEY ME TOO!" and jumps in before you hit the button, this camera automatically UPDATES for this new kid/increase in the number of faces. SO the stress is gone! There's no need to rush everyone to get in the picture because it just KNOWS when a new face pops in. Even when my kids are moving and rearranging it adjusts for the perfect shot without my having to refocus.I don't see how you could come up with any more features at this price. It's just the perfect camera. Not too heavy or bulky either, fits right in my pocket. Crazy! And since I don't really take the time to adjust my ISO settings, I typically just use AUTO and it's perfect every time. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift! Extremely easy to use camera for the skilled as well as unskilled photographer
Reviews.Author: Nice Lady "a reasonable person"
Reviews.Content: This is just a great camera.  Around 2002-2003 this same camera was about $350.  We've still got that  original camera & it has been terrific, so when we  wanted to get a digital camera that could just 'point & shoot' by a non-computer savvy person-this fit the bill.This elderly gentleman was able to take high quality photos and get them onto a computer to email them to me.  Now, that's pretty good. He doesn't even own a computer!Mentioned it to a high level engineer friend of mine.  To my surprise, I found out his entire family (another engineer , plus a college student) all had this camera & they are very pleased.  They also gave this camera as a gift to an 83 yo woman who has found it very easy to use & get the pictures on the computer also.This is a lightweight, durable, highly versatile camera.  What a great buy!Heartily recommended.  (Love the colors!)

Reviews.Title: Tough camera and good photos
Reviews.Author: Widely Read
Reviews.Content: I saw this camera was rated #1 for point and shoot image quality on some camera review sites. It also has quite a lot of flexibility in choosing how you want your photos shot. This is a great camera that I can carry when it's not convenient to have my big DSLR and lenses with me. I've dropped it several times and although it's a bit scratched up now, it still takes great photos and battey life is excellent!

Reviews.Title: HAS COME TO THE RESCUE MANY TIMES
Reviews.Author: D. CAPONIGRO "MEERKATMOM"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as an extra.  Whenever my Husband and I go to the zoo or sightseeing I always have him take photos just in case my DSLR doesn't capture the closeups the way I like.  Well Hubby has gotten many gorgeous shots that I have missed.  This little camera is amazing and I highly recommend it.  Since it only has a 4x zoom it is not reliable for zoom shots but hey that's what the DSLR is for.  You will love this little easy to carry camera.

Reviews.Title: Great basic camera that's an upgrade from previous Canon PowerShots
Reviews.Author: Charlotte
Reviews.Content: I bought my first Canon Powershot in 2006, but I had to replace it when the flash suddenly stopped working.  I bought this PowerShot A1100 IS, and I have been really impressed with the improved quality of the pictures I take.  I recently took a vacation to San Francisco, and I had a ton of fun and success taking all kinds of pictures--some in the bright sun, some in the drizzle and fog, and some at night.  It seems that no matter how unlikely a great shot was, I still got them.  Since most of my usual pictures are of closeups of my child and family, it was a nice surprise to see how well this camera captures cityscapes, far-away images, and bright city lights at night.What isn't any different from my previous Canon, thankfully, is how easy it is to use.  I take pretty banal pictures and don't have much skill, but I do want to document vacations or cute family memories.  So I consider it a great plus to  the Canon brand that anyone--even someone like me--can use their cameras with great results.

Reviews.Title: Zoomed shots invariably out of focus
Reviews.Author: T. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I've owned numerous film and digital Canon cameras, usually upgrading every couple years and sticking with Canon because of good experiences, but this camera has spoiled so many shots that brand loyalty is out the window now for me. Any shot zoomed over half way to maximum will invariably be way out of focus.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabee Chime "Elizabee Chime"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the price.  I bought this because it had a view finder which is a nice feature on a sunny day.

Reviews.Title: Canon A1100AS
Reviews.Author: H. J. Schwarze "John S"
Reviews.Content: Camera works fine. Because it is out of production, the price was 3x what I paid for the first one.

Reviews.Title: Poor build quality
Reviews.Author: Ralph Rosen
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. After about a year of ownership, the battery/memory card cover latch refused to release. Out of desperation, I pried the cover open which damaged the hinge. I did manage to get the cover to re-close. However, the next time I choose to open it, it appears as though it will have to be pried apart again. Eventually I suspect that such forceful opening will damage the cover to the extent that it will be broken for good. UPDATE 10/1?13. My prediction came true. After after three years of ownership the cover latch failed completely. The camera is in the trash.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda Pitts
Reviews.Content: since my purchase of this camera I have done many projects with it.  I have made many 8*10 pictures that look professional. A lot of people have complimented me about how good the pics turn out.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot 12.1 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: EZReal
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great buy, and Seller is hightly recomended. Easy to use and picture quailty is great! If you are looking for a easy to use and quailty to boot this is the camera to buy.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: laura
Reviews.Content: Really like having this camera.  I usually leave it in my car.  Came in very handy when I had a slight auto accident, was able to take pictures to help the insurance company.

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot I've Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: After trying to move 'up' to another camera, I realized this is really an amazing camera.  The 'better' camera didn't work nearly as well as this smaller, simpler camera.The macros are in clear, sharp focus.  The distance shots work better with this 4x than the upgrade I bought with 14x optical zoom. I took a picture of an owl that was a good 20' from me and though it looked a bit like a watercolour, it was a great photo for so far out of the optical zoom range.  I uploaded the shot so you could see it.Okay, so maybe the purples aren't that purple.  You can try different light settings to get the colour more accurate, and it doesn't take forever to find the light setting.The modes are simple and easily accessible.  You don't have to go through menu after menu to set up a shot.  I highly recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Glad I found this camera
Reviews.Author: P. Wolf
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find this older Canon Powershot model, and I was so happy to find it on Amazon. Friends had it, and I liked the features and photo quality.  However my main reason for buying it is that they no longer make digital cameras with view finders. A dark LCD in bright sunlight is very problematic for taking decent pictures. This is one of the last good ones. The Amazon re-seller was great. Description said "used", but it was indeed brand "new".

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera with a couple of faults
Reviews.Author: Powershot Jack
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital after usings SLR's for many years. This Canon takes great photos and is fairly easy to use.  I'm impressed whith how it adjusts automatically to take fine handheld interior shots in dim cathedrals as well as perfect exposures at the beach. It offers far more resolution and features than will be needed by an amateur photographer.  I have dialed it back to a medium pixel setting and it is still incredibably sharp. I took it to Europe a few months after getting it and was rewarded with hundreds of outstanding pictures.  The option of taking pictures through the view finder is nice but in practice I doubt you will use it much as it doesn't give the exact framing of the image being shot.  Now for the down side.  I only get about 45 shots on a set of alkaline batteries.  Rechargables would be well worth investing in.  The battery door is a weak design and you should uses your finger carefuly to apply support and pressure when closing. No problems yet by being careful.  My camera cost only $140 on Amazon October 2010.  Don't know why they seem to have gone up since then.  The instruction book that came with it is pretty limited.  You have to download the disc on our computer to get full instructions.  A full printed instruction booklet would have been nice. After about a year it suddenly stopped downloading pictures to my computer after doing so many times.  The computer did not recognize the camera for some reason.  In fairness this may have been the fault of my computer. I never really resolved the issue of fault between the computer or camera.  But I got around the problem. I bought a $10 card reader and put the memory chip in it and it downloads the pictures to my computer without a hitch. A further word of caution; get into the habit of slipping on the wrist strap EVERY TIME you pick it up.  It slips out of the hand very easily, especially if you are used to dealing with a bigger camera. Overall I'm really very happy with the camera and the pictures it takes. Especially at the price I bought it for.

Reviews.Title: Canon Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: gloria
Reviews.Content: Camera was defective.Lens cover did not shut completely; stayed half open allways.Returned for credit; could not be exchanged.

Reviews.Title: Not for architecture
Reviews.Author: Joseph Nichols
Reviews.Content: The lens on this camera has extreme barrel distortion and cannot be used for photographing anything with straight vertical or horizontal lines, i.e. buildings, interiors of buildings, or anything that has straight line references. I use this camera now only for landscapes or people. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Constant Battery Problems
Reviews.Author: katrina
Reviews.Content: This camera has caused me to miss out on capturing so many meaningful events because it constantly flashes the "change batteries" prompt and shuts down.  I have returned it to Canon twice and each time they have returned it to me stating that there is nothing wrong with it. I have bought the most expensive rechargeable batteries that they have recommended and still, I might get 5 - 12 shots and it again flashes "change the batteries".  I have NO photos from this Christmas because of this stupid camera.  I will never again purchase a Canon product because they DO NOT stand by their warranty.

Reviews.Title: I Love it
Reviews.Author: Courtz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The one thing i would like if it could change the color of the picture and was able to add a backgroung to the picture. Other than that the camera is awesome. Be careful of one button " format sd card" it is located in settings it earses all the pictures on your camra. It is good if you want it to happen otherwise it is a pain in the butt.

Reviews.Title: Flimsy
Reviews.Author: Ann Summitt
Reviews.Content: These thinner bodies result in flimsier materials.  The on/off button - it is difficult to distinguish whether or not you've pushed it.  The battery/card door is also flimsy and very difficult to open and close.  This particular camera quit working (and we can't figure out why) after only 7 months of use.  Average use was once per week.  This camera is/was used for work - we design roads and take pictures of cracks in the pavement, street signs, i.e., things that don't move.  We are NOT hard or abusive of the equipment.  Next camera will have a fatter body.

Reviews.Title: A Great Affordable Choice with a Viewfinder!
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money.  I would prefer a larger Optical Zoom.  This is one of the Very Few reasonably priced pocket sized digital cameras with a Viewfinder.  I consider a Viewfinder an essential feature for taking pictures in outdoor sunlight!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot 12.1 PM camera
Reviews.Author: Mark H Baxter
Reviews.Content: Very nice portable camera. Purchased for vacation overseas and I liked the fact that it took AA batteries, so I never had to worry about charging. Camera works very well. For a point and shoot I have no complaints about portability or image quality. The only thing I will say is the batteries do not last. I get around 50 pictures or so between needing to change batteries. I could not decide whether to go 3 star or 4 star but since my only complaint is battery life I give it a 4.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot A1100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Silver)This camera is pretty good. It takes amazing video and great quality photos. It's got a 12.1 mp and the 4x zoom is very good. Once you get into the digital zoom it does get a little grainy. I've used this camera at a birthday party and at an outdoor event. The one huge flaw that annoys me is that when you use the flash a lot such as night time photos. The time it takes for the flash to recharge again is ridiculous! You take the picture than the picture leaves the screen and it takes 10 seconds before the screen comes back on the display. When you're trying to take pictures of moving objects it's irritating to wait for the screen to come back up to take another picture. I would say this camera is great for picture quality and it does take good night photos but the wait time in between photos is very annoying for the flash.

Reviews.Title: Pam
Reviews.Author: P. Fitch
Reviews.Content: A great camera for the money BUT it is cheaply built!! I bought two of these cameras in March (2010), as of Sept. both are broken. My camera fell 2 feet onto a plush carpet causing the on/off bottom to fall out! Now the camera doesn't go on!!My daughter's camera also fell from her hand into some bushes. The zoom button now doesn't work and the review photo button also doesn't work!! Both drops were light and this kind of damage should Not have occured!I've had many canons and I've dropped them piles of time. I never experienced this breakage in the others. I'm sure canon won'tt fix them free because they were dropped so I'm stuck with 2 useless cameras bought 6 months ago.

Reviews.Title: AS1100 cameraIS
Reviews.Author: S. Welch "mountainbloom"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera especially since it has a view finder.  Easily fits into your purse or pocket as well.  I wish the upgraded cameras had a viewfinder as well; especially helpful when you are outside in the sun.

Reviews.Title: An exceptional camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Grant
Reviews.Content: This camera is a replacement for my wife's older digital camera for carrying in her purse or pocket. She still wanted it compact with the convenience of using easily available AA batteries. The camera that this Canon A1100 IS replaced was only three years old but it had a typical problem of unacceptable shutter lag. This Canon is quite adequate in regards to it having very short first and succeeding shot delays.'Regarding battery life.' Two AA batteries are not going to give you as many photo shots as rechargeable dedicated batteries. You should not have any problem as long as you are aware of this and keep spare batteries available. For longer battery life you can turn off the LCD display when you are in brighter areas and use the viewfinder We have been able to exceed well over one hundred shots even with the LCD display on one set of AAs. This included reviewing, erasing, and editing photos'Optical viewfinder.' In some of the reviews there was some complaints regarding the size and accuracy of the viewfinder. At least this camera has one. It is getting rare to find point and shoot digital cameras with one. It is a matter of squeezing in a larger LCD display with the more compact cameras with little or no room for a viewfinder. There are times I still like a viewfinder for quick shots.'The macro mode' This is excellent on this camera. I took some photos well within two inches of the subject with excellent results.'The owner's manual.' The supplied CD user guide is one of the better ones I have seen. I think it is well written, particulary for people that are less familiar with digital cameras. I would still suggest making a print out of the manual for convenience. The printed 'quick start guide' is the best I have ever seen.We have several digital cameras that range from ultra compacts to DSLRs. This is one camera that I suspect we will use often. All in all this is a fun to use little camera. My only regret is that instead of getting the green we should have gotten the pink one 'and' a blue one.

Reviews.Title: Fuzzy
Reviews.Author: C.M.77 "CM"
Reviews.Content: I had 3mp and 8mp cameras that I feel took better pictures.  Most of my problems were with indoor pictures coming out fuzzy and/or pixelated.  There is an easy setting and even with using this function I still had poor picture quality.  I know this has a 12.1 MP, but to me it is of no use if the pictures come out the way they did.  I did read the manual and even with following the suggestions for taking picutres I still had this problem. HOWEVER, As far as taking "posed" shots in very good lighting the pictures came out GREAT, but for taking those pictures of activities, especially indoors (yes I did use flash), I have many poor images of great memories.  I am definitely not a "technical" type person, but with owning two other digital cameras I didn't have this type of a problem. It seems like an easy to use camera, So I guess that is why I am so disappointed that I had this problem.

Reviews.Title: Few flaws, mostly excellent
Reviews.Author: Neil in Oakland "Oakland Dad"
Reviews.Content: take tons of vacation pix, and have two main attributes i require for my camera:a) still need a visual viewfinder, i'm often outside, in bright light, in sunglasses, and have a very hard time framing shots with the screenb) need batteries; often rafting or backcountry camping without electricity, and had to have a camera that i can replace batts inused to have the olympus, but lost it, and tried this one, and overall very happy.two flaws i've identified so far:a) the dial on top (for settings) is EASILY moved when putting camera in and out of your pocket, so often i'd go to grab it, and it would have shifted to a different 'program' or usually 'movie', annoying as could beb) was checking memory card status, and it's WAY too easy to hit 'format' which deletes all your pix! found this one out the hard way. there absolutely should be an 'are you sure' screen (like when deleting a file on the computer). i'm pretty tech savvy, so if i could do this inadvertently, it's probably too easybut that being said, for the size / price / quality, and given my needs listed above, very happy.if you need these issues too (viewfinder and batteries) this is probably the right low level digicam

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: " Anti Microchip " "Jesus Christ can ...
Reviews.Content: Bought the Canon powershot a1100 IS for my wife at christmas. I have to say I have an old Nikon camera with 4 megapixels that is faster at taking pictures. The Canon has better quality if everyone stays still. Since I have children that really is not practical. The video feature is OK, the image stabilizer sucks in my opinion (yes we have it set for kids and pets), and if I were to grade it I would give it a solid D. 66% of it I like, 44% I don't like. It hasn't failed us in every aspect but if I had it to do over again I would get a different product. Glad to see they have upgraded it since I purchased it. The newer version might be better.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Grandma G "barbg"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes fantastic pictures.  The big thing I don't like is that there is no instruction book with it.  The company says they're "going green" and you can download the book, but you have to print it off to have it in front of you when you need it so you are using paper--how green is that?  Also, some things I found out the hard way is that the date & time do not show up on every setting and I didn't see that on the 30 pages or so I printed off.  For me, the absolute amateur, I NEED A BOOK! I do like the camera-- it has an infinite variety of settings, etc.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Carlyn Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera gives you excellent pictures for a point and shoot.  Easy to hold and zoom.  I really like Canon, I have several of the A80's and A95's that when we had a problem with them Canon repaired them at no cost.  You can't say enough for a company that stands behind their product like Canon does.

Reviews.Title: Overall satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Diamond
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have so far is on certain settings, it takes too long for the picture to load; therefore, you cannot continuously shoot pictures.  You have to wait a few seconds in between.  Other than that, it takes some of the best quality pictures that I, as an amateur, have ever taken.

Reviews.Title: Good, solid utilitarian camera
Reviews.Author: Gertrude, the Good Queen "Live well, laugh lo...
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for the basic purpose of snapshots that did not need to be very detailed and will not likely be printed larger than 4 by 6 inches.  We were looking for a camera that would be sturdy, reliable, and easy to use.We bought this camera for our oldest who builds boats.  He documents the stages of the boats on a daily basis and it is good for him to be able to view what the photo looks like so he can confirm the quality of the photograph and then get on with his work.  It also allows him to make estimates about new boats he is producing.  As a recording device, this camera works well.  This makes it a huge improvement over the 35mm manual Nikon he was using, not only because it is digital and he can access the pictures more easily but also for the ease of use.He also uses it for photographs of his children, which he mostly downloads to his computer.  Because most of these pictures are on-the-fly snapshots, high-resolution images are not necessary and would in fact bog down his computer that does not have a lot of memory.The included software also worked perfectly well and easily--all necessities for someone who doesn't have the time to fool around with pictures.This camera is a good work horse, in that it does respectable photographs that don't need a lot of work on them and have good resolution.  It also is pretty sturdy which is necessary in the shop environment it often lives in.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera + Excellent Pictures
Reviews.Author: Big Mike
Reviews.Content: Yo-Was looking for an easy 'point-n-shoot' and this is it for me.  Set it on 'Auto' and shoot away - extremely difficult to take a bad picture. I have mine set on 'M2 Normal' which will give me about 10,000 shots on my SDHC 8GB Transcend Class 6 card at 2592x1944 megapixels - resulting in excellent pictures that are still a reasonable handling size.The camera is decently small and contoured enough to easily slide in and out of my front pants pocket. I'm using Sanyo 'Eneloop' rechargeable batteries and they are lasting for at least 500 or so shots before I replace them.All in all - this is very fine - affordable camera for your own personal use or as a gift (I have since given one to my daughter-in-law and one to my 14 year old grand daughter - and they both love them).

Reviews.Title: Last of the viewfinders.
Reviews.Author: D. Maass "Authartist"
Reviews.Content: This purchase was to replace an identical camera that crapped out (the telephoto control jammed the shutter button).  The predecessor couldn't be repaired (it was still under warranty) and we insisted that Best Buy return our money, which they did.We like this camera because it is one of very few compact cameras remaining that still use a viewfinder in addition to the LCD screen.  Other criteria included its use of AA batteries instead of expensive proprietary cells, and the use of SD memory cards that had fit in another Canon predecessor camera.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!!!!
Reviews.Author: amateurcook
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth point-and-shoot digital camera that I've owned since 2002, so I have a standard of comparison by which to make this review.  The battery problems of this camera make it unusable.  I bought the camera primarily because it will use standard AA batteries.  I inserted the batteries that came in the box with it, took about 6 test shots and received the "batteries exhausted" command on the screen.  I went to the store and purchased lithium batteries, which last a lot longer in digital cameras.  The camera got so hot to the touch that I could hardly hold it.  I turned it off and let it sit for couple hours.  When I came back to it I turned it on and got the "batteries exhausted" command again.  I put in yet another set of batteries and let it sit overnight.  In the morning it was completely dead.  I came to the conclusion it was exhausting batteries, even when turned off, so I contacted Canon.  They sent me a UPS shipping tag and I sent it in for repairs.  (Free) Yesterday I received the "repaired" camera back from Canon.  I put in a set of fresh batteries, took a dozen or so test shots, turned it off.  This morning it is AGAIN completely dead.The "repaired" camera came with a note from Canon stating that it had been "restored to factory settings."This camera exhausts batteries, even when it is in the "OFF" position.  It's defectively designed.  DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Buy the green one it's cheaper
Reviews.Author: Red
Reviews.Content: My last camera was a Kodak and I liked it quite a bit and it did the job. However, the battery compartment cracked and therefore could not read the full battery. I was just about to go out to the West Coast for the first time for a quick trip and knew I needed a camera. Although I searched some Kodak's my sister recommended trying Canon instead. I didn't want anything to big or too small. Just something that would do the job but not take up half a suitcase. I chose the Canon Powershot A1100IS 12.1 because the reviews were good and the pictures that were posted looked good to me. But I must say it is even better then expected. It is easy to use, and the picture quality is fantastic. When I got back from my trip and printed my pictures I could not believe the vibrant colors and quality of my photos. This camera makes any amateur look like a professional. I would definitely recommend this camera to my friends and family. One last note, the green Canon Powershot was like $20.00-$30.00 dollars cheaper and it's cute. I didn't care what color it was as long as it did the job so I figured why pay more if I could get the green one cheaper. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Not what I was expecting...
Reviews.Author: C. Bernard
Reviews.Content: I am a die hard Canon fan! I ordered this hoping for the best in that price range. It's a great camera and I don't regret my purchase.I was disappointed to discover it lacks in setting options. My old Canon had a lot of setting options and I loved the fast moving setting for taking pictures of the kids. This camera has a kids and pets setting but does not take good pictures when there's a lot of movement from the subjects. I have tried all the settings and am disappointed.Overall I am happy with my purchase but advise anyone looking for a range of settings to look spending a little more money on a more advanced Canon camera.***After using this camera a little more I felt compelled to add to my review. I wish my old 4 mp canon still worked! This camera has been a big disappointment! Any movement of the subject and you get a fuzzy picture. There's also an orange sensor light that is irritating and I haven't figured out how to shut if off (if you can). Every time I try to take a pic of my baby he stops smiling to check out the orange light.

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera
Reviews.Author: G. R. Janckila
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, love the optical view-finder (which is one reason I bought it), turning off the LCD screen saves on batteries.  In sunny conditions the screen is hard to see so the optical view-finder is almost necessary.  I don't like the shutter delay.  I'm accustomed to a film camera's instant shutter.  I have taken about 30 photos, which all look good on a computer screen, have not yet printed any photos but at 12 MP those should print well, even printing larger size photos.For a less expensive model it is great.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera.
Reviews.Author: Alley Sally
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a lot of searching on different web sites.  This site had the best deal with no shipping charge, at the time, which sold me!I am not an experienced photographer, so I needed something easy to use and to  understand how it worked.  With a little help from my daughter, I learned how to use this camera and it's functions.  This was only the second digital camera I ever owned.I am impressed with Canon Powershot, since I owned a Kodak before this.It is easy to use and takes good pictures.  I'm glad I made this choice.  I would recommend this camera for your purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: K. Mays "student"
Reviews.Content: I've gotten great high quality pictures of my 2 year old daughter, inside, outside, every expression with the "burst" which takes many pictures in a row.Batteries have been running out quickly, I've heard you should use expensive high quality batteries, the generic ones just don't cut it for camera use.So glad I bought this! And it really is the best deal on the market.

Reviews.Title: All you'd want in a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Gene Walker
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon.  The other two were handed down while I got more pixels.  It's simple to use and takes great pictures and short movies.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Dimarzio
Reviews.Content: For me the best part of this camera is the viewfinder. The LCD screen is great as long as you aren't outdoors in a sunny situation. I have missed too many pictures because I couldn't see the screen. With this camera I have the option of either one. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Canon A1100is the last of it's kind?
Reviews.Author: Burke L. Storti
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon A1100S. I lost my first one on my trip to Ireland last year. I chose this camera primarily because it has an optical view finder & it is powered by 2 AA batteries. Being compact makes it a great travel camera. The batteries can be purchased any where & I always carry 2 spares in my pocket. To obtain maximum battery life, I use the optical view finder with the viewing screen turned off. The optical view finder is also good to have in bright light conditions when the viewing screen is difficult to see in bright conditions. Unfortunately, Canon is not going to produce this camera anymore. Like other camera makers, Canon will no longer offer similar AA battery cameras like this. I wouldn't mind having a camera that requires special batteries but there seems to be no battery size standard in the new cameras. Each maker uses their own unique batteries that are not interchangeable with other makes/models. They are expensive to replace too! Purchase this camera at a great price while it's still available.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Henry Sullivan
Reviews.Content: 12 mega pixels! This is a fantastic deal! Look, for those who are expecting a SLR, high dollar camera, this is NOT it. However, this is a great deal! We have shot hundreds of pics since our purchase, and absolutely LOVE it! We've also shot numerous videos, and they are great quality. This camera was super easy to use and learn.My only critique is the batteries. It does seem to burn through them rapidly, especially if you use flash, or shoot video. If you purchase this, I would highly recommend buying rechargeable batteries (we got a setup with charger, 4 AA, 4AAA for about $20).I HIGHLY recommend this camera, it is definitely worth the price.One last thing, for those who aren't happy with this camera and have posted bad reviews, RETURN IT! You cannot beat this for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great all-purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Book Mom
Reviews.Content: We got this for our teenage son to chronicle his adventures without worrying if it got beat-up. He loves all its features and the pictures are better than the ones taken by our more expensive camera. It is easy to set up and use, small enough to fit into a pocket and has lots of different functions for different lighting and scenery.  The only negative we have discovered so far is that it eats up batteries pretty quickly. On the plus side, it takes regular AA batteries which are easily found and replaced.

Reviews.Title: Easy for my first digital
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: I have used regular SLR camera's and the cheap SLR type camera's all my life. I still have a Cannon AE1 with all the goodies. I don't know if I'll ever take it out again.This as i said is my first digital and it's so easy to use. I borrowed a different digital from my son and I had to reset everything every time I took the batteries out that never lasted.This is a snap, put it on auto, adjust the distance hold it still and shoot. That was exactly what I wanted.I can pull out the chip, plug it into my PC or reader and easily delete and save pics.Buy it, I hope you get a good one like mine.One day I'll read the manual and take even better pics.I like to by stuff like a radio, turn it on and it just works.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Martin Kroser "Mart the Krow"
Reviews.Content: This is a true point and shoot camera.My 7 year old kid is taking fantastic pictures with it.The face recognition works well.It is a bit slow writing to the memory card.

Reviews.Title: Batteries
Reviews.Author: J. ahrens
Reviews.Content: The camera does a very fine job in taking pictures, it has very logical ease of operation but the battery, part of the purchase, allows only the shooting of less than ten pictures before overheating. I did not realize from the add that this was not a camera with a rechargeable battery! Cameras previously bought always had a charger and the battery to match!

Reviews.Title: A Good Buy
Reviews.Author: William J. Gilmore "Bill"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Canon A1000IS which worked very well, but got lost at Mardi Gras. I can't get over the quality of the photos I have taken with this camera!  I use this camera daily on the job to photograph structures and the fine detail is unbelievable.  When I photograph welded joints at a distance over 10' and use the zoom my photos appear as if I am looking through a magnifying glass.  Away from work photos I have taken are sharp and crisp looking.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen Robinson "mare"
Reviews.Content: I've owned a wonderful Canon camera for a while now(Power Shot SX10IS) but it is big and bulky and not convenient to carry around with me, just in case i need it. I cannot tell you how many times i have said I WISH i had my camera with me....Well, i bought this little beauty and keep it in my handbag and have used it countless times. I am thrilled with the ease of use and the quality of the pictures it takes. I would definitely recommend this camera to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: flimsy battery and memory card cover
Reviews.Author: D. P. Dice "D. Dice"
Reviews.Content: light weight and very cute looking......great quality photos.....however, the battery and memory card cover is very flimsy and feels like it could break with very little force. My older canon's cover worked better and felt more heavy duty.

Reviews.Title: cheap construction - battery compartment door broke
Reviews.Author: CaringConsumer
Reviews.Content: Frustrated with this camera, which we've had for 2+ years. It takes great photos, don't get me wrong.  The compartment door to the battery & SD card compartment broke. It is made of plastic and a little catch piece on the door broke, so that the door will not firmly close.  This causes the the camera to read that the batteries are low and the batteries seem to drain much faster now.  We've taped the door shut, and I even hold it shut while I'm taking photos. It's a real pain. B/c of the frequency of removing photo cards from cameras, any mfr. should make this part of the camera metal. For this reason only, I don't recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for Grandmom
Reviews.Author: Pat T.
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to find a simple to use point and shoot camera for myself, and this is it.  My husband has his SLR camera to keep him happy with a whole list of features.  For myself, I just wanted a camera that I can put in my pocket or handbag to take quick on the spot pictures of grandkids.  I really don't think I need to use anything but the auto mode.  I've only had it for a week, but I love it already after playing with it.  I just turn it on and let the camera decide which is best for me to take that picture of my grandaughter playing her violin.  The price on Amazon was great.  I saw it advertised in a Best Buy store for the same price, but I decided to go with Amazon with free shipping and no sales tax.  The shipping was very fast even in our NJ snowy weather.  So- if you're looking for a easy to use camera for a youngster or a senior citizen like me, then this Canon AS1100 is for you.  Like I said, all I want to do is point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied With The Canon A 1100 IS
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: The size is good for me.  I take it every where in my coat pocket.  I have experience with technical features but wanted a simple point and shoot camera.  The A 1100 IS as simple as it gets.  However, it does have manual override features if I want to us them.  I get great results with just point and shoot and that's all that I wanted.  Photo's are sharp and crisp coming off my Canon printer.  I am very satisfied with the color.  I am really pleased with the purchase and do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Camera worked for 1 day then quit.
Reviews.Author: T. Layman
Reviews.Content: Received camera and was able to take pictures for one day before camera stopped working. Kept making a clicking sounds but would not take pictures. I think the clicking was the autofocus trying to focus. Replaced batteries still no luck. Was going to send back to Amazon for a replacement but they were sold out. Sent back to Amazon for full refund. Great service from Amazon. Went to WalMart and bought another one just like it and it has worked perfectly for past 2 months. Wife loved the style and model so we decided to give Canon another try.

Reviews.Title: What a compact point and shoot should be
Reviews.Author: ElectroGuru
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a miserable week with a "high-end" Canon (SD980is) that wouldn't take a good picture no matter what I tried. This A1100 is a pleasure. The pictures are beautiful. Adjustments are intuitive, it seems to be fairly foolproof. This camera is well-built and sized right to hold in your hand. Has the right amount of features for the non-professional but high-expectation photographer. Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: Bad indoor quality, short battery life
Reviews.Author: Kristina M. Marchiani "KMarchiani"
Reviews.Content: The indoor picture quality is about the worst I have seen.  If indoor pictures are important to you, do not buy this camera.  Also the battery life is unacceptable.  The camera comes loaded with selling points which make it sound great, but all that goes to waste once you see the end result of the actual (indoor) photos taken.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: Herman Cress
Reviews.Content: This Canon Powershot has been the perfect gift for my wife. She wanted a camera that would do all the work for her since she's not camera smart. Who need's to be with this Canon because it truly does the work for you. Now my wife is a little professional at taking photos, which turn out picture perfect. I would still recommend getting rechargeable batteries with this unit. If you don't know much about using a camera - not to worry, this one will do the work for you. It has lots of extra features so when you get brave enough to adventure on your own there's lots of goodies to work with. A happy wife makes a happy husband. Thanks Canon.

Reviews.Title: Delivers more than advertised
Reviews.Author: A Karl in Elk Grove
Reviews.Content: This Canon PowerShot A1100IS is the replacement for the A1000IS, and it continues the great features of the older model.  Not only does it bump up the megapixels to 12, but there are several features I like about it:- it automatically saves "portrait" formatted pictures in portrait mode; no need to rotate the image with software afterwards;- it's quick to take pictures -- about 1.5 seconds from a cold start to taking the first image;- takes only 1.5 seconds to stow it too;- a amber-colored sighting beam to "target" your subject for focusing;- an adequate zoom mechanism; and- the choice of viewing the image in the panel on the back, or the viewfinder.I had a chance to use the A1000IS for most of last week after my Nikon L4 conked out on me.  Although the Nikon was a great little camera and traveled the world without problems for a few years, it finally developed a 'smudge' inside the lense that couldn't be removed.  So I borrowed my nephew's A1000IS, and I was amazed.  The bullet points above are the distinct differences between the L4 (and the L20, I think) and the Canon.  When it comes to SLR's, I'm a Nikon guy.  But this Canon is clearly better than the L4 and well worth the extra $40+ over the L20.

Reviews.Title: Bought for wife and would buy for self.
Reviews.Author: T. Butler "mathman"
Reviews.Content: I measure products in terms of bang for buck. This camera has incredible bang for buck. The cost is low, and the quality is high. The pictures are clear, crisp, and with excellent color and contrast. It is easy to use. It is light weight, but does not feel cheap. The zoom has improved a lot compared to older versions of these cameras. I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!!!  It is super easy to use and takes Great pictures!!!What more can you ask for?I Love IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality photographs, really easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Emulsified
Reviews.Content: This camera takes macro shots and landscapes equally well and has done superb job so far with autofocus and automode light settings, both with indoor and outdoor pictures. It's an extremely good value, and I'm really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Very poor image quality, but nice interface
Reviews.Author: B Howell
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a PowerShot A75. I don't need lots of special features. All I wanted was a clear, sharp image with good color fidelity -- as good as my A75 (which died) would have been fine. Since I bought the A75 more than 5 years ago, I figured that technology would have marched on by now and, even though the A1100 is cheaper, it would be as good as or better than the A75.I was wrong. The A1100 interface is great -- very clean and intuitive -- but the pictures are lousy. I mean, really lousy: poor focus, poor color fidelity, simply not acceptable at all. And I'm not a professional photographer (obviously, since I bought this cheap camera), so it's not that I'm super-picky. I had figured that, with the A1100 getting so many five-star reviews, maybe the less favorable reviews would have been somehow mistaken, or the people got lemons. They weren't mistaken, and if they got lemons, well, so did I. Yech!I returned the camera. Unfortunately, I hadn't checked the return policy of the third-party vendor, so I had to pay a restocking fee. Never again! If returns mean a restocking fee, I won't buy it in the first place.The long and short of it: Don't buy the A1100.I've now bought a PowerShot SX120 IS (I do still like Canon). It's more $$$, but hopefully better picture quality. After having taken just a few indoor test shots, I can already see that it's better than the A1100. I hope that will continue to be the case as I test further. I'll try to post my review by the end of December.

Reviews.Title: Dead after not even a year
Reviews.Author: Diane Farley
Reviews.Content: We bought this after our last child was born for the built in stabilizer. it worked okay. After less than a year it started sucking the life out of our rechargeable batteries. We bought new batteries, (not cheap), and a new battery charger (not cheap either).Oh, and a new internal battery ($4). Obviously, those weren't the issue. So, after maybe 500 pictures and less than a year the thing is dead. Very disappointed since I have always bought this brand. Not anymore.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: M. Hines "Teacher"
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon Elph and was very happy.  I thought this one would be just as good.  NOT HAPPY AT ALL.  Picture quality is not good.  The time between being able to take the next picture is too slow.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing-Slow recovery and blurry, noisy, grainy photos
Reviews.Author: Allison Collins
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurbished model and have been consistently disappointed. Long lag time between photos. (3-10 seconds), blurry images, yellow-orange cast, blinding flash that washes everything out, grainy, noisy pics. The list goes on. My experience with the A590IS was terrific. This camera has been terrible. I cannot help but think that 12mp is overkill, as my 5mp CanonS3IS only produces 5mp, and they have never been too low of resolution for any purpose I have encountered. Usually with Canons, you can set the dial to "Auto" and point & shoot to your heart's content. Not so with this model. Auto & Easy are both unreliable and even with the ability to program settings, nothing has helped. Maybe the refurb is flawed, but this baby is going back to the seller.

Reviews.Title: It has a lot of features, but battery life is short
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: It has a lot of features, but battery life is short. My old Canon had 4 aa batteries, this one only has two. So... you only get maybe half the pictures before you need new batteries. I use Alkalines, I was not happy with the rechargeables I used withmy old camera. They would not hold a charge very long.Over all a very good camera with limitations.Steve

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Marsha J. Dunsmoor
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on vacation and got a lot of good shots.  I am just an every day photographer and found it to have a lot of features.  I LOVE that this camera actually has a view finder; as that is hard to find anymore.  In really bright outdoor light, I find it hard to see the LCD screen, so I appreciate the view finder.  For the price, this is a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: So far......
Reviews.Author: Christine Collar
Reviews.Content: I was so excited that I'd finally picked a digital camera, after reading hundreds of reviews. It seemed like I'd never know which one to buy. I own a fairly ancient Canon AE-1, which has served me so incredibly well over the years, but in the past few years I've found that finding a way to have my film processed for a reasonable price has seemingly vanished. I wanted to purchase a Canon product, and finally settled on the PowerShot A1100IS with 4x optical zoom, 12.1 mega pixels, and image stabilizer. The camera seemed fine, out of the box, small & compact. But the instruction manual is severely lacking. Yes, it told me how to install the memory card, the batteries, (which were not rechargeable AA batteries, very wasteful there), the wrist strap, and how to take photos in the AUTO and EASY modes, how to film a movie, and of course how to see what you'd photographed. There are a lot more things that need to be known about how to use the different settings and that is NOT included in the paper manual. It seems to be in the instructions that I uploaded onto my computer, but I would prefer a manual I can hold in my hands and refer to, not to have to find it in my laptop, as I rarely have my laptop handy when I'm taking pictures! To sum up, I can't give a very good review, at this time, as I haven't learned all there is to know about everything the camera can do, thanks to Canon not including a physical manual.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: B. Salagaj
Reviews.Content: This camera was a replacement for my 11 year old Cannon S40.  The picture quality was not so good in low light when in auto mode but if you switch it to low light mode the pictures are decent.  Over I'm happy with the camera but I do feel the auto mode is lacking since my 11 year old Cannon S40 just worked without thought when in auto mode.The a1100is is a good camera overall but did take some tweaking of the settings to get the pictures to come out perfect.  I recommend turning off the auto object focus and set it to center and I've noticed a huge improvement in all the photos.  I feel this camera was a great deal for the price and would recommend it if you are willing to spend a little time to learn how to use the settings to get the best pictures

Reviews.Title: AA's
Reviews.Author: Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: Best batteries yet!  I'm tired of loosing the special cable necessary to charge the battery for camera. This is one of the few camera's I found that uses standard AA batteries. Doesn't matter if I'm traveling or at a school event, I'm not looking for an outlet to charge or a converter. I can carry extra batteries with me. Change 'em out and I'm good to go.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy - You cannot go wrong with it.
Reviews.Author: Shashank Parulekar
Reviews.Content: I recently got this camera to gift it to my sister. While I got a chance to play with it I could not stop short of exclaiming Wow's.I regularly use my DSLR, but the ease-of-use provided by this camera has got me into thinking of buying one for myself.Though Canon stopped providing Manual exposure controls Av, Tv, M, ... on their lower-end point-and-shoots the pictures still come out pretty good.There is a Program Exposure feature which can be played with to your liking.The optical IS is a boon and I have come to appreciate its value since I have wasted quite a lot of photos on my DSLR as I cannot hold the camera still enough while the shutter has been opened.Hopefully Canon starts making the A590IS series which now sell for more than $200. In the meantime Canon A1100IS is your answer to better photos.

Reviews.Title: Not sure why it got good ratings-Indoor pic quality is not good
Reviews.Author: nsr "Photo Hobbyist"
Reviews.Content: All the indoor pictures I have taken so far did not turn out good. The auto white balance is not good, pictures are soft and grainy even with flash.Currently use Canon A610 and Canon XS SLR, ofcourse I am not comparing to my SLR, but I thought I will get quality to close to my A610 which is 4years old camera. Unfortunately it is nowhere near the quality of A610. Even at low ISO settings it has lot of noise in photos. Autofocus is surprisingly slow for recent camera, and flash re-charge cycle is even slower. I do not see a point in paying premium for Canon brand specifically this camera.

Reviews.Title: Value for money
Reviews.Author: Arunkumar C. Gopalakurup "Arun"
Reviews.Content: A very good product and prompt service from amazon, except for the high delivery charges. The product is working satisfactorily, but battery life is very poor. Battery lasted only for two uses. Should educate the customer on using camera and battery effectively so it may last longer.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera however, it is too complicate for me. Would be good for someone who is really into photography. I got a Kodak right after getting this one and it is so much easier, I just really point and shoot. Guess I should resell this one. It is very nice.

Reviews.Title: Bought it used but it arrived as new just like it was described.
Reviews.Author: S. Meyers
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Very convenient and has a look through view finder in addition to the screen.  I wouldn't be without this feature.

Reviews.Title: Click Click
Reviews.Author: Boris
Reviews.Content: I bought this like 3 years ago for my sisters birthday. She promptly lost the camera. I hope someone got some use out of it.I remember this being a cool little camera for in its day.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money. Not the best for moving targets
Reviews.Author: Victoria Nelson
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. It has decent battery life. My only beef is, it takes a while to snap the picture sometimes which if you have little kids of any kind of moving target might not be ideal.

Reviews.Title: Remember the extra batteries
Reviews.Author: grandmanana
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and takes fine pictures.  Be sure to take extra batteries.  It eats through batteries pretty quick if you are going on vacation and taking hundreds of shots.

Reviews.Title: Eats Batteries
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Fortman
Reviews.Content: It eats batteries.  I do not care for cameras that run on just two batteries, they never last long enough.Other than that i love Canon Cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good for bottom of the line model
Reviews.Author: P N
Reviews.Content: This is a good for the price. Startup is decent and the pictures can be taken. Nothing serious and the autofocus is slow but that's to be expected. This is for someone who wants to keep a small camera in their purse and take some snapshots that will be better than their camera phone.

Reviews.Title: the perfect camera
Reviews.Author: ERIK LEVERINGTON
Reviews.Content: this camera is the perfect size for carrying and the battery life is fantastic and the picture quality is just awesome for such a small camera

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Don Beatrice
Reviews.Content: Works goodTakes great picturesLove the Zoomeasy to load on computerMenu is easy to read and setup

Reviews.Title: Didn't Last Long
Reviews.Author: Mary M.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why they require more words on reviews? So I am waisting your time reading this as I am my waisting time doing them a FAVOR!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John Wolf "www.cerm.info"
Reviews.Content: Have used this Camera since 2009 and do not plan to trade it in for the non view finder garbage cameras they make today. Many today think that a Smart Phone is a replacement, but they are very far from that. Get this camera.

Reviews.Title: Green Canon
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of years.  It takes beautiful photos ,but all of a sudden, when I use the szoom the photos get fuzzy.  I have tried all the corrections the camera suggests, but to no avail. Please let me know what, if anything, I can do to correct this problem.  Thank you,  Fran Hurst

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot a1001s
Reviews.Author: Sharon Wilson "nana"
Reviews.Content: Great camera to carry everyday in my purse for those special family picture treasure shots that come up unexpectedly. I love the color and the ease of using the menu at a moments notice.

Reviews.Title: Super point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Rocklin Research
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excellent point and shoot camera with many features found on single-lens-reflex cameras. I have bought three of these cameras. As they wear out from heavy use, I replace them with on-line purchases.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: M.A.R.
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for years & it took great pictures. I recently upgraded to a new camera as the batteries just wouldn't last like they used to. I keep this as a spare though.

Reviews.Title: Google "Cannon Lens error" for the whole story
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: This camera was nice when it worked but the lens jammed. This is the second Cannon camera we have had that did this (this one was a gift). No way I'd ever buy another one. Google "Cannon Lens Error" to see for yourself. Over 2 million hits!

Reviews.Title: Exactly as specified
Reviews.Author: Richard J. McGuckin
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera.  I dropped my and destroyed it and was saving for an advanced model so a new Canon 1100is was counter productive.  The used one from Amazon is perfect.  It works perfectly and the pictures are ideal...  The seller shipped the camera promply and it arrived in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: Camera operates sub-standard & unacceptably
Reviews.Author: Clara M. Shepardson
Reviews.Content: 1st use was Easter Sunday Large gathering in my field for sunrise service.  Every photo I took had bright green around the edges of every major component of the photo.  My daughter, later @ the sunrise breakfast, turned off the flash but that did not help.  Irreplacable photos!!

Reviews.Title: Seller Misrepresented Camera as Like New
Reviews.Author: Harmon Harris "SD Rowdies"
Reviews.Content: Owner advertised camera as like-new when in fact it had a broken and missing shutter button that no user could possibly overlook. To repair a broken shutter button on that model camera the entire front of the camera must be replaced. Paid $200.00 plus shipping for a clearly defective camera that also had notable cosmetic scratches on it.I ordered repair parts from the Canon USA Parts Center at a cost of $34.50 and was able to replace the front section of the camera myself. Between ordering and delivery of the camera, assessment and decision to take on the repair, ordering and delivery of repair parts, and affecting repair it was a full two months before having a useful camera with lingering regrets.What would make me feel better about this Amazon experience? A $200.00 deposit in my Amazon Account, that's what.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Donna Vorburger
Reviews.Content: Arrived very promptly, actually earlier than expected.  Great price, excellent condition.  Almost new.  Happy to have found it as it had a view finder that new cameras do not have.

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: STM
Reviews.Content: my photographer relative wants to have copies of my pictures that i take on vacation now, produces good quality pictures

Reviews.Title: I loved it.
Reviews.Author: Trimama
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately after about 2 years I started having sensor issues with all the pictures turning purple and streaky.  But until that point I loved this camera.  Compact, tons of features, great options for different scene settings.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Nilutz6
Reviews.Content: Love it. Great look and easy to use and take pictures with. I love it, no complaints from me. Great price.

Reviews.Title: Wife very happy with camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Greiner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been sharing the same camera for some time so I decided to get her her own.  Being very happy with our Canon PowerShot I got her the A1100IS.  She is very happy because it operates like the other Canon and also has higher picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Decent for the price
Reviews.Author: Jdove
Reviews.Content: This is not an outstanding camera, in fat, it is pretty mediocre.  On the other hand, it is compact, easy to use, and lightweight.  It is great to just have in my bag to pull out when the phone camera just won't cut it.  Since it isn't a huge investment, I am not worried about damaging it.  My favorite feature is that it uses regular AA batteries.  They don't last as long as other types, but it is nice not having to use a charger or loon for pricey specialty batteries.

Reviews.Title: Canon A1100IS
Reviews.Author: Jenn "vegan queen"
Reviews.Content: Not a bad camera, but it isn't the best for low light situations.  Video quality is just OK, audio not good in loud situations.  Only bought it at the last minute to take on a trip because my good camera went MIA...(Canon30XIS). Fine for travel and quick snap shots in good lighting conditions.  It's small and very lightweight.  Would be better if it had more zoom, but I've been spoiled. I love that it takes AA batteries though-hate it when I miss out on opportunities because my batteries died and I can't find/afford the specialized batteries (or have to wait til they charge up again).

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries like crazy after 1 year of use
Reviews.Author: P. Alenkina
Reviews.Content: I usually love Canon products. I had a Canon prior to this camera, but decided to give it to my sister-in-law and get a newer version instead.The good: I love all the different picture taking options it comes with. It makes it fun to play around and the quality is just fine for the price. That was the good.The bad and the ugly is that currently (after 1.5 years of use) it eats batteries like there was no tomorrow. I mean, you will put in brand new batteries in it, then NOT u use it for 2 weeks AT ALL and then you won't be able to turn it at at all, unless you put in new batteiries. At first I thought , it was the crappy battery. But then when this happened again and again ( last time - today), I started to get really frustrated. Imagine: you put in new batteries, then you have your work week, then you go out with your family on the weekend, pop out that camera and it DOES NOT TURN ON. I guess a solution could be - take out the batteries right after use and put them back in when you are ready to use it again.Bottom line: if I knew this would happen before I bought this and despite all the things I like about it,  I would have bought something else.

Reviews.Title: Not a happy camper!
Reviews.Author: Ajrambo
Reviews.Content: The camera broke after one year...the auto lens is stuck and after forcing it closed one time per troubleshooting tips online, it is stuck again and will no longer work.  The camera felt super cheap to me when I first ordered it.  I would definitely NOT recommend this camera...now to find another one...ugh!

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Hammer"
Reviews.Content: I used this camera in Afghanistan.  It worked well.  It was cheap enough for me to take it with me.  Not sure if it's as good as some other cameras such as coolpix or whatever, but it was a lot cheaper when I bought it.

Reviews.Title: A Gift I Gave, Still Used to This Day......2011
Reviews.Author: Peter Hurley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after a great deal of research for a friend's Christmas gift. She is very techno challenged and we set it up together. She uses this camera to this very day and has taken 1000's!!!!! of photos without a single issue. She is tickled to death having this item and if she can use it well, anyone can. Her photos are excellent, the batteries seem to hold up well, very sturdy item. Buy this camera, espcially if you want a great point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Most Unhappy
Reviews.Author: byebye
Reviews.Content: Purchased within last year, and it has been back to Canon three times for "repair".My first use was at a family gathering with a new great grandchild.  I was only able to take 19 pictures!! (at that time, I did not know that the battery would "revive"!Each time returned as "no problem".  Still under warranty,  and when I sent it the last time I told them I was concerned that the problem would not be resolved before the warranty ran out.  Their answer?  Not to worry, because I had 90 days after each return to send it back!Using nothing but Nickle-Metal Hydride rechargeable batteries, still could not get more than 20-30 pictures before battery dead, but after several hours, the battery would all of a sudden revive and could take a few more pictures, then battery dead again.  Checking Canon's site, I see that more than half of the reviews on this camera complain about the battery life!This model has been discontinued! But I will not buy another Canon product.

Reviews.Title: No complaints.......love it!
Reviews.Author: househuntress
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this camera!  So easy to use-picture quality is great-I couldn't be happier.Love the lightweight of it and the size.  My older one was heavy and bigger which makes this one so enjoyable.  I did upgrade to a bigger card than the one it comes with and am using rechargeable batteries.  But it's great to know that regular batteries last a while if you're in a bind.  Got the light green colored one-it's beautiful.  Helps identify my camera over my friends' because it's such a unique color.  I wanted a reputable manufacturer and I got one in Canon-they're great! Amazon had the best price around with a free upgrade card and shipped it so quickly!Love the 4x optical zoom and large display screen, too.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!
Reviews.Author: Jou
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on Amazon December 2009 and loved everything about it.Pros: Very easy to use and figure out the settings of this camera. the weight and the way you hold the camera is appropriate and does not feel like it will fly off your hands. The video option works great and voice quality from video are pretty good as long as there is not too much background noise. Camera images are great and you can create great effects with lighting especially at sunrise and sunset, you can't beat the quality for the price!Con: you've got to get a memory 4GB sd card like I did or at least a 2GB or even larger than 4GB....you can set up the settings so that you can store thousands of pictures without feeling the pressure of uploading your pics to clear the memory right away. And especially if you choose to make videos which takes more memory than pics. but this is like every digital camera and so this is not a real con!I am totally bummed since I lent my family my camera recently and it's now lost. I brought this camera on sale for $129 but now it's listed for $248. I will check the lost & found at the Museum of Science (where it got lost) to see if I can find it! If I can't find it I will have to break down and save up for this same model. I also have plenty of friends/family that has the same or similar model which they too enjoy. I did hear that the new version of this camera does not take the clearest pics compared to this model and it is much thinner and easier to drop.

Reviews.Title: Camera with a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Agate
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera used after I broke the screen on an identical one. The old one still works, though, because it also has a viewfinder. We could not find any new models with that feature.  Camera has a selection wheel on top so you don't have to rely on the view screen for everything. With the other camera, we took videos and made home movies. For the amateur photographer, there is no longer any need to own separate video and still cameras.

Reviews.Title: "lens ERROR" seems to me a camera ERROR
Reviews.Author: That minecraft dude
Reviews.Content: After less then a year of owning and caring for this camera all of a sudden it came up with a lens error and it grinds when the lens opened and closed. it took decent pictures. and i always had in the the case when was not used and never dropped. I took it to get fixed and it would have cost me the price of the camera to fix it. =( if i turned the camera off and on like 15 times it would turn on properly to work. which is strange. i am looking for a new camera as we speak. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA FOR BUSY SNAP HAPPY MOMS AS SUCH AS MYSELF. i used it alot. and then one day.. nothing.

Reviews.Title: GREAT, GREAT Camera
Reviews.Author: Charlie Pifer
Reviews.Content: This is super easy to use and just big enough that you can grip it but not too big that you are lugging around a rock of a camera!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use - good little camera
Reviews.Author: Lady Shopsalot
Reviews.Content: I don't know about you...but when I'm on vacation or at a party, I actually want to be in the moment, and not fussing around with complicated photography equipment simply so I can impress my friends with how much I spent.This Canon PowerShot camer really fills the bill. It takes good picutres, with ease of use and is small enough to take with you on any vacation with no hassle at all.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Went with a Nikon after this camera was sent in for repairs twice for the same issue.Was a victim of the dreaded Lens Error both times.Canon refused to repair the second time due to "water damage."  Only got to take maybe 100 pictures on it.  Very unreliable and would not recommend to anyone.Went with a Nikon Coolpix L110 12.1MP Digital Camera with 15x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) and love it.Lens Error info and STAY 20 FEET FROM ALL LIQUIDS! lol[...]

Reviews.Title: Good but almost new not "new"
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: Good and fast delivery.  Only thing is I wouldn't say "new" but "almost new" since the standard memory card is missing it's not "new" and the package was definitely opened.  Otherwise everything was good.

Reviews.Title: Poor Construction
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Owens "Living in Michigan"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in April '10. By October the battery door would not stay shut. Every time it opens the camera turns off. Then the lens cover came off on Halloween. It is so disappointing to think I now need to buy another camera. We have had a 3MP Canon since 2005 without one problem. So we thought for sure another Canon would be great. I am doubting this now.

Reviews.Title: Just average
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: I owned a Canon PowerShot camera a few years ago and I loved it.  I was hoping to get the same picture quality in this newer model, but I was very disappointed.  I have a 1 year old daughter who rarely stops moving, every picture I take turns out blurry.  Everyone tells me that I need to invest in a SLR, but I got great moving shots with my old Canon camera.  I understand that it's difficult to get good pictures of a moving child, but I get maybe 1 in 250 pics is a print worthy picture.  The only feature that I like is the rechargeable battery.  I can take about 250 pics before the low battery signal comes on.  It also charges within an hour.

Reviews.Title: Power Packed Camera
Reviews.Author: lynn a nettleton
Reviews.Content: Tha Cannon PowerShot A11001S 12.MP Digital Camera has a nice large screen and many nice options that are easy to use.  The camera is compact and light but still offers a nice 4x optical zoom and image stablizer that focuses in quickly.  Icons for the settings show up to help get the right setting.  Flash on and off as well as shots micro, macro, or normal are easy to put on. I have not changed the batteries yet and have used the camera for quite a long time (a real plus).  I think minimizing the time the screen stays on is helpful.  Being able to shut off the sound is also a good feature.  The view finder is helpful but not overly clear to look through.  On sunny days when the screen may be tough to see it would still be good to have it.  Night shot setting is amazing.....clear shots, everyone....looking like they were taken during the day.  A very nice camera and good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: CameraWithAView
Reviews.Author: AllEyes
Reviews.Content: First function then style.  I find this model and brand to meet my functional needs superbly.  Not too big and large enough to have AA standard batteries and optical view finder.  Until screen view finders can perform in sunlight, I will always go with an optical view finder.  I find the efficiency of this camera to allow more than enough battery life from AA Lion batteries now commonly available.  Oh! and what a fine movie mode.  Viewers are very impressed with the results of family and air show results in the movie mode.  I will keep my fingers crossed that reliability can keep up with the fine engineering functional design of this camera.  There should be an award of some sort for all the hard work of making this product happen.

Reviews.Title: Great For A Beginner Like Me
Reviews.Author: Nubia
Reviews.Content: I love my camera, it goes everywhere I go.  The price wasn't bad, After watching the video, I became a pro.... Very Glad I purchased this camera

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bluehat
Reviews.Content: Great little camera that puts up with a lot of dropping and other physical abuse. Seriously, I carried this with me every day until I upgraded to a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Super Spiffy Camera
Reviews.Author: dithmerea
Reviews.Content: I love my little camera!  It's perfect for taking on a hike or backpacking, it uses easy to find AA batteries, it takes lovely pictures, AND it has a view finder, a rare feature in cameras of this size.  Plus it is green, my favorite color - what more could I possibly want in a little point & shoot camera?

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: swescott
Reviews.Content: I have had Nikons in the past and this camera is much more sturdy and easy to use.  Battery lasts alot longer too.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Gigie
Reviews.Content: Love this camera and I keep it in my bag at all times. It takes great photos for every day snapshots when a dslr is not convenient to carry. The only complaint I have is the lack of a Sports mode. The Children and Pets mode is the closest I can find and it does an alright job with kids. However, although I've gotten a few good sports shots with it, it's still on the slow side and not fast enough to catch some of the best action shots.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot camera
Reviews.Author: gloria
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera, however, I find it difficult to open and close the battery compartment.

Reviews.Title: great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Greg-o
Reviews.Content: takes just the right pictures for the price.  I use the camera for when I need a camera that I can afford to damage/loose (on water, etc).  It takes great still pictures and acceptable moving ones if you set it up right

Reviews.Title: Good and Easy
Reviews.Author: GB
Reviews.Content: Perfect product.. Canon make picture taken way too easy. Auto, point and shot, that's all folks

Reviews.Title: Simple to use & takes good photos
Reviews.Author: Franz "Frisbee Grandpa"
Reviews.Content: My 90 year old "Mother-In-Law" finally decided on this camera after trying two others.
