The positives for her was that it had the eye viewer, AA batteries (not the rechargeable ones) and was easy to operate.  The LCD viewer is clear also.  The camera is easy to hold in your hand. She even had an old case that this camera fit into.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot A1100IS
Reviews.Author: Wycliffe
Reviews.Content: I was able to use the camera easily with minimal practice including the zoom.  The menus are easy to find and easy to understand.  It weighs next to nothing but seems really sturdy.  I've never felt confident about photography, but with this camera I'm looking forward to learning the more advanced features

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara A. Meisner
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed many cameras.  This is the best of the digital cameras I have seen so far.  I will keep this one!  It's a keeper.... and so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Hitman "Hitman"
Reviews.Content: Great value, quality pics, easy to use. I use it professionally as a backup to my Rebel and take it with me everywhere. I had the ten MP version and it was great, took over 45k images before it broke, lense got stuck open, but the camera paid for itself many times over. Best low cost point and shoot on the market.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: DRB
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and produces pretty good pictures. I also own a similar camera from Samsung that sucks batteries and produces pictures that are almost as good. For a camera that sells for less than $200, it does its job wel.

Reviews.Title: Great Graduation Gift
Reviews.Author: Boooooks
Reviews.Content: I am an unsophisticated camera user. I bought this camera for my grandson's 8th grade graduation and took pictures with it throughout the 2 1/2 hours of ceremonials and reception. I handed it to him with his class pics within at the end. It was easy to use and batteries were still going strong at the end with a lot of on/off switching during the evening. I have not seen the pictures out of camera yet.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Camera in a hurry
Reviews.Author: Mom of Three Girls "Mom of Three Girls"
Reviews.Content: We had to replace a 5 year old Canon PowerShot after our 5 year old broke the old one.  Looked at online reviews & consumer reports.  Seemed to be the best bang for your buck.  It is a great bang for your buck.  The picture quality is very good - better than the older more expensive one.  The only feature we don't have that we liked on the old camera is a quick shutter.  It was good for capturing small children without having to wait for the shutter to catch up.  The quality & size makes me not miss the feature much.  GREAT BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love my Cannon except for one thing!
Reviews.Author: Carole B. Mccarthy
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera but have a problem with the battery and card being in the same compartment. Having to hold the button down while opening it makes it hard to open  and I am afraid I will break it when I open it. I had to have my daughter get it open for me and she felt it was poorly made as well.  That I feel is the only defect in the camera-. That part should have been made better.  I love the green color and the size makes it easy to manage.  I like the way it focuses for you when taking pictures.I still believe the above but feel after having used it awhile, I have gotten used to it and am better at opening it. I do like the camera.

Reviews.Title: Worth The Money
Reviews.Author: R. Mark
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much for $150.00. I was pleasantly surprised when I started using the camera. It has more features then I'll ever use, but it's nice to know that they're available. The pictures I've taken, both indoor and outdoor, were very good. The video really surprised me and my family. I didn't buy it for the video, but it's so good, I bought a bigger memory card. I highly recommend it in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Clemenson "Kindred6"
Reviews.Content: Like the camera.  Still have issues with zoom photos becoming grainy but the camera works well.

Reviews.Title: Does a good job.
Reviews.Author: church
Reviews.Content: This camera does all it is said too, and more. Playing with most of the features is intuitive. It would help if the booklet that come with it had more info, for times when you don't have online access. Great size, very comfortably to handle. Wish it came with a better memory card, they are so cheap now.

Reviews.Title: nice reliable camera
Reviews.Author: Scott Contestabile
Reviews.Content: When I bought the camera,  I purchased an extra memory card because you never get enough memory with the canon digitial comeras.  However,  other trhan that,  its a nice every day camera for taking better than average pictures.  There are a lot less moving parts to worry about then my old digital olympus that failed long before its time.  This camera has been going strong for a good while now and I alwasy try to bring it on fun occastion.  The auto focus works suprisingly well but sometimes it is off; which is why I take multiple pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera!
Reviews.Author: Shana Akira
Reviews.Content: I spent quite a while researching which camera I wanted. I picked this one for several reasons. I like the AA batteries, the close-up abilities, and it has a fairly nice zoom. Great camera, would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: S. Gould
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, fits most anywhere. First one I purchased had battery usage issues, but so far this one seems fine. Good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: G. Winkleman
Reviews.Content: love this camera, had one a year ago but it was stolen so i was glad to find Amazon still had one available as they have been discontinued by Cannon for a newer model.  Takes great pictures, very little shutter lag, battery life is good with Lithium batteries and it is very simple to operate.  Only drawback to the camera is i wish it had a longer zoom.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: C. Nagel
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a great price. Easy to use. Bought one for my mother in Florida, and she loves it too.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Hendrick "blue bull"
Reviews.Content: Just pure delight to use this camera. Great value for money and would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Mary L. Levine
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It is easy to use, and takes beautiful pictures. The instructions are easy to understand, it's easy to operate and does a great job. I highly recommend this as a great camera that is user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1100IS
Reviews.Author: STEVEN Mcmullen
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best small camera I have owned. Firstly the price was right, secondly the ease of use was of a great importance to my wife and I. I was getting so fed up with instruction booklets which were 220 pages long and about as easy to read as the magna carta.The picture quality is also very very good and I imagine that I will never stray away from canon products in the future.This item was a great find.

Reviews.Title: Novice loves it!
Reviews.Author: kt "kt"
Reviews.Content: I am a total novice when it comes to digital cameras.  I read all the reviews, queried my students and based on everyone's ideas and suggestion I bought this one!  It is absolutely wonderful and makes me look good as I produce nice crisp shots without shaking or chopping off heads.  My only wish would be a place tofasten a strap on both sides of the camera.  I bought it for both taking pictures at school and for the quilt shows that I attend.  I would like to have it moresecurely fastened to my person rather than dangling from my wrist.  Other than that, it is absolutely wonderful and fulfills all my expectations!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: charles mahaney
Reviews.Content: This camera is a steal for the quality you get. The pictures come out great. The menu is a little hard to understand, but I'll get used to that in no time. Very few fuzzy pictures even in low light. Just a good camera for 100 dollars.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Briefcase Camera
Reviews.Author: V. Lange "vlmagister"
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal on business and frequently need to document client settings and situations.  Also, I have found that in traveling, camping, hiking, it's always great to have a small, capable camera that is expendable.  If it can also provide qulaity photos, that's even better.  I've always preferred the color rendition and clarity of the Digic chip, and this camera simply does an excellent job.  Can I create a better photo with my 5D or 7D?  Sure, but I'll not throw either one of those in my briefcase or just tote them in my pocket on the Long Trail.  It's the "camera I have with me," under these circumstances, and for that, it is a true winner.  It's a product of genuine quality and value, that perfectly pegs the market for which it is intended.I've owned three now and have destroyed two (after some effort!)  The first was dropped about 30 feet.  It destroyed the ability of the camera to show photos that had been taken, but it still worked fine in preview mode.  I hiked 200 more miles with it and took almost 1000 shots over that distance...precious shots I am deeply grateful I have.  The second was dropped in the Carribean and was packed with sand and salt water.  I rinsed it in fresh water, blew out as much moisture as I could with compressed air, and left it in a bowl of rice for about a week.  It worked fine, I gave it to my son, and he eventually bounced it down a set of stadium stairs.  It still worked but the battery door was damaged and the lens retract mechanism was shot.  We retired it.  Number three has been treated a bit more gently, but that will almost certainly change - then I will get number 4.  Bravo, Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great Pics
Reviews.Author: James A. Taylor
Reviews.Content: We got this to take on vacation and were not disappointed. It takes great pictures and videos.  With an 8gb card it takes almost endless videos and pictures. Downloading to my pc is a snap.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Ralph E. Armitage "armbruster"
Reviews.Content: I have had prior Canon products and have always been impressed with their intrinsic value, whether copiers or cameras. This camera does not dissapoint. It's easy to use, has great picture quality and is priced right. This particular one was purchased for my sister-in-law who saw how happy we were with our previous purchase. She is very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon makes a Nice Simple Camera
Reviews.Author: Victor Ray Krebs Jr.
Reviews.Content: I have had 4 Canon camera's... they have all been a good buy.My wife had a Sony small camera... and didn't like it...was hard to use ....  I talked her into this camera...and she loves it..  Simple,clean,smallJust the camera she needs.

Reviews.Title: A great product
Reviews.Author: C. A. Perna
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures. The quality is fantanstic. The camera its self is fun and easy to use with alot of great features. Love it. I recommend buying this product.

Reviews.Title: cannon a1100
Reviews.Author: David Youngblood "Dblood"
Reviews.Content: As good as twice the price.. Crystal clear......I took a pic of an old black and white photo taken in 1930 and it came out better than the original. Even makes a 66 year old man (me) look good. I recommend even for professional use.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Deanne Ross "DRoss"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that I could just drop in my purse and go for those "Oh, I wish I had my camera" moments.  This camera was an ideal answer.  Picture quality is very, very good, and even though I have not used all the features (and there are many) on the camera, I'm sure that the rest will be up to par.  My suggestion would be to take the time to read the manual (provided on disc) to learn all that your camera can do.  But if you're like me and want to hurry up and "point and shoot", this camera works like a dream!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: W. Fisk
Reviews.Content: I just love my new canon powershot. It's easy to use and takes great pictures. Also, the price was incredibly low.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Paul G. Jr Anderson "Paul Anderson"
Reviews.Content: I don't like to fuss so this is great for my use. Just point and shoot and get great pictures. Small enough to to fit in a pocket but large enough to hold securely. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera at a great price!
Reviews.Author: M. L. Rudd "bAd_Ass_mAmA"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to capture every memorable moment of my kid's lives and for trips and the like. It has a ton of nice features and it is a great camera for the price. its not professional quality, but its perfect for personal uses. The pictures are crisp and clear and the colors are true. A great buy imo!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot 12.1 MP w/4x Zoom
Reviews.Author: T. nelson
Reviews.Content: For the price of this camera and ease of use, this is an excellent buy.  I have children and love the ability to take candid or potrait shots.  The range of options is precisely what I needed without having to read a manual before taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Hiker Girl
Reviews.Content: This camera takes awesome pictures, the zoom is great, and for the money is an excellent product. The one thing to be careful of is not to use it in extreeme cold. The inner lens gets foggy. It is fine once it warms back up. Great product though, unless you are ice fishing. :)

Reviews.Title: Is, what it is
Reviews.Author: Dog Boy "Dog Boy"
Reviews.Content: For the size and for its' designed use, it's a nice little, point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful littel camera
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Shimko
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my wife.  Her last camera had a little accident with the chair and 'died'.  I chose this camera becuase of its size and color (she loves green).  I have a larger Canon Powershot and I love it, but this camera comes in very handy for those quick shots around the house of our cats or our little nephew.  It also comes in very handy when out on the town with the nephew and a smaller, more descrete camera is necessary so we don't look like the press.  I recommend this little 'giant' to everyone.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: MIRTA M DAVIS
Reviews.Content: I just purchase this Camera for Christmas, is really wonderful camera I love it, is ease to use and excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Gravy "Gravy"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, easy to use, purchased as a gift for granddaughter, she likes the color and features.This is the third Cannon PowerShot I have purchased, other two are for work and have never needed repairs,they just keep on keepin on

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot A1100
Reviews.Author: Janet Brunton
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera for the price. The picture quality is excellent and it is very easy to use. I keep it in my pocketbook all the time and the battery life is great. I use rechargeable double A's. The movie quality is also good for a small inexpensive digital camera. I upload short clips to a website to share with family and it is easy to do and so handy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy for beginning/intermediate photographer
Reviews.Author: James T. Higgins
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to replace a lost camera of about the same price, by a different manufacturer, and we find the Canon to be much better.  We rate it highly for value at this price.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Frederick Carnes
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas Gift for my Fiance. She loves it. She does a lot of listing on Ebay so she needed a camera that would take quality pictures and still be portable for personal use. Plus she loves pink. The camera has a lot of cools features to it that I had never seen, like tracking the faces of everyone in the picture.

Reviews.Title: This Canon camera is a perfect addition to the amateur photographers line-up
Reviews.Author: Jason Puffinberger "disco biscuits fanatic"
Reviews.Content: This Canon camera is a perfect addition to the amateur photographers line-up....portable but not too small where you can't push a button without contacting another one. The image quality is astounding for the size of the camera. The only thing that could be improved upon is the automatic zoom feature...it's nearly impossible to turn off (or at least I haven't figured out how). It would be nice to be able to choose your own subject from the field of view, auto focus on it, and then adjust the camera without losing your object of focus in the final photograph, but I don't think that's possible, even when you turn the auto focus off. Uff Da. Any suggestions? All in all, it's a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: Carolyn C. Alexander "cc"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift.  The camera seems to work very well and she is excited about the pictures she has taken.  She is extremely pleased with this camera, and it arrived on time (before Christmas).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Doramus "Lover of  Westerns"
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my lady friend for Christmas, and it takes great pictures. She immediately purchased the photo printer which produces great pictures. I own a Powershot S3IS so because of it, I chose Canon. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great features
Reviews.Author: O. PRIES
Reviews.Content: Bought this item as a gift. Wanted a simple to operate digital camera. Recipient was surprised with the capabilities of this camera. Yet, the most common modes are easy to set and use. The Program mode, which addresses 80% of photo taking requirements was very useful.The primary reason this Camera was purchased, it provides an additional view finder when using outdoors and in bright light situations. This feature is very helpful. I was a part time professional photographer and found this feature helpful. Activating the grid system helps in both vertical and horizontal alignment.Would have appreciated the inclusion of a AC converter to preserve battery life.When using the flash mode it becomes a carbon based battery hog. Suggest using rechargeable NIM batteries.

Reviews.Title: Small, beautiful...
Reviews.Author: Vaniko
Reviews.Content: A lot of reviewers write about the great features of this camera.I just wanted to say that I was quite surprised how small it is. Barely a half of my palm. Still playing with it. I'm happy so far :)

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot 12.1 MP
Reviews.Author: KodaColor "KodaColor37"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot A1100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Silver)Arrived in a timely manner. Easy to use. Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: C. S. Almodovar
Reviews.Content: My husband is in love with the camera and taking pictures of every flower of the garden.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera/Great photos
Reviews.Author: Marsha Conant "Marsha C"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 13 year old daughter - it is eady to use and takes great pics!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!  Perfect for a pocket or purse
Reviews.Author: Tisza Major
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my best friend as a Christmas gift and she couldn't be happier with it.  The camera takes great pictures, is super easy to use, takes AA batteries so you can get them anywhere, sees really well in low light conditions and fits easily in her purse.  In fact, her hubby just went on a trip and decided to take this camera with him instead of his Canon DSLR because it is just so easy, light and takes such good pics.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: D. J. Heath
Reviews.Content: Fine little camera. I know it's highly rated by consumer reports.  I have used it a little and it produces high quality photos.  The IS is very welcome and close focusing is great.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1100IS
Reviews.Author: Jeff Flinn "PC Tech"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small camera that my neice could carry with her easily.  I also wanted a camera that used AA batteries so she wouldn't miss any shots because the battery needed charging.  This camera was a bit more bulky than some of the slim cameras but it is still easily carried in her purse or front jeans pocket.  And, of course, it uses AA rechargable batteries or AA alkaline batteries.  She loves it!  I have used Canon digital cameras for several years now and the interface has always been easy to use and is the same with this camera.  The image stabilization is a plus for low light situations.  It lets her use the 4X zoom even when the light is not ideal.  I was concerned the 2.5" screen would not be big enough given that most of the very slim cameras have 3" screens but after seeing it in action I think the screen is very usable.  Overall, my neice is very happy with this camera and has already commented that when the batteries ran out while on vacation she was able to purchase a couple more AA batteries on the boardwalk and she was back taking more pictures in a matter of minutes.  You wouldn't be able to do that with a camera that had to be recharged!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1100IS
Reviews.Author: Rilla H. Mewbourn
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera, easy to operate, and the photo quality is very, very good.  I purchased this camera because it uses AA batteries, which can easily be replaced.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Daniel Wagoner
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for the average American who wants an easy to use, easy to carry, reliable camera or camcorder.  The picture quality is great except in low-light conditions when you can't use a flash.  The battery life is also excellent.  Alkaline AAs will last you for over a month with moderate use, and Lithiums will last you for several months.  The camcorder feature is also excellent, creating .avi files that can be easily put on your computer.  This is an upgraded model from the A590 IS which I have also used.  This camera is even smaller that the A590, making it even easier to carry in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Battery life is terrible
Reviews.Author: L. A. Surprenant
Reviews.Content: This camera is very portable, has very good picture quality for a sub compact and is easy to use. But the AA battery life is probably good for 25 pictures only. I find that pretty unacceptable compared to the rechargable battery "card". I'll be trading this in soon.

Reviews.Title: ok camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Ellis
Reviews.Content: nice camera a little hard to figure out. great pics when you have on the right settings.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use camera
Reviews.Author: Norvelle Couch
Reviews.Content: A very easy to use camera.  You will be making excellent photographs in a few minutes. Almost as soon as you insert the batteries.  The engineering for this camera is so well done.  The balance is very good and it is easy to hold.  The settings are also easy to apply.  The cd that is included with the camera is an insert into the computer and it does the remainder type of installation.  The cables packed with the camera are easy to use also.  Within the first hour you will be taking photographs that you always wanted to do.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Best upgrade to date
Reviews.Author: TraciB
Reviews.Content: I decided to get this camera based on the video quality of another Canon I have access to at work.  When I received my camera (excellent overnight service, by the way; well worth the extra $19.95), I was able to take it out of the box, insert the batteries that came with it, and start shooting immediately.I have yet to explore its full range of features, but I'm thrilled with what I've seen so far.  This is my fourth digital camera, my third point-and-shoot, and my first Canon, and I seriously doubt I'll need to upgrade again for some time to come.One of my favorite features is that even though it has a view screen on the back, it also has a viewfinder.  One of the major drawbacks to most P&S; digital cameras these days is the elimination of that feature.  When you're outside in bright sun, it's so helpful to be able to put the camera up to your eye and actually see what you're trying to photograph.The fact that the camera runs on AA batteries is another thing I really like.  I already had some rechargeables, so when I ran the juice out of the ones that came with the camera, I just popped in the others and could keep shooting.If you're looking for a good digital camera at a wallet-friendly price, this is one to consider.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in this camera
Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera.  I also own a Canon Sureshot (35mm) camera that hasalways produced good pictures.  I wanted a point and shoot without all the fanfare.When I first got the camera, I went on vacation to Newport, R.I. and took many outdoor pics, all of which came out great.  The color was fabulous.  I could not have been happier.  HOWEVER, I have since taken many indoor pics around the holidays last year that came out far from perfect.  They were awful ~ and had a yellow and green cast to all of them.  I had the camera in Auto mode which should have been fine and the batteries were new.  When I compared the same pics that were taken with a 35mm camera in the same room on the same day, no comparison!  The color of all the digital pics is way off.  The battery life is not good with this camera either.  I know AA's are not going to last like the other batteries, but this camera really drains them fast.  I have since returned it, and am shopping for another digital camera.

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: Sadie's mom
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with my purchase.  This camera is easy to use and takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Maria M. Noriega
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 11 year old son and he loves it! Really easy to use and very nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for on the go
Reviews.Author: J. Cart "packrat201"
Reviews.Content: I have been a fan of Canon for awhile, I have the Rebel XSI, love it.  I decided to purchase this camera for a simple reason I do not always want to cart around the BIG camera, and frankly it does not fit in my pocket.  The operation of the camera is easy to use. Takes great pictures, and very easy to print directly to a printer or anywhere for that fact.  Great Lil camera for on the run.  Would recommend to my Mom.

Reviews.Title: great camera, great gift
Reviews.Author: Seabeauty "Seabeauty"
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the features in this pocket camera -- it has several that previously were exclusive to DSLRs.  I bought it as a gift, and the recipients cannot stop raving about what a terrific camera it is, the clarity of the photos, ease of use, etc.  This was a great value.

Reviews.Title: Pleased again.
Reviews.Author: Charles A. Havlicek
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this camera several times as gifts.  Good camera, easy to use and great battery life.  You can't go wrong with Canon.

Reviews.Title: A Life 2 Remember
Reviews.Author: M. Upton "A life 2 remember"
Reviews.Content: My first camera a Christmas gift to myself! I wanted 2 c what they say they c when they look @ me (I c it; I like it; lol). Read the instructions and you should be able to figure out the rest through trial and error. I am still working out the kinks. I will get back to u when i try to download photo's to my computer/facebook. It shouldn't be rocket science or is it? For the price of this camera it apears to be a great buy! So far I have enjoyed my Canon.

Reviews.Title: Wicked Awesome
Reviews.Author: L. S. Fein "60ties music mave"
Reviews.Content: The camera is WICKED AWESOME because there is no need to program it.  You just point and shoot. Cool colors and easy to use.  I received the camera as a gift and could not be happier with its performance.

Reviews.Title: canon
Reviews.Author: Muhammad Afzal
Reviews.Content: I am fully satisfied by this camera. It makes very good pictures and videos. batteries goes longer time.

Reviews.Title: good basic camera
Reviews.Author: F. Burton
Reviews.Content: I selected this camera to replace my older [and hard used] Canon power shot A530. I needed a camera that used easily obtained batteries--not the rechargable ones used by so many new cameras. I also wanted a view finder for the many situations when the screen was simply not visible.  I did not want 'smile detectors' or touch screens. This camera seemed to be the only choice. It was a good choice and has met expectations. It is harder to hang onto than the old power shot which was nicely grippable. It seems to take marginally better pictures. All told--I am satisfied with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Maggie
Reviews.Content: I bought this before going on a trip and it was easy to use and took great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Alaina J. Rogers
Reviews.Content: I bought this just before I went to NYC, so I didn't have a lot of time to figure it out before I left.  I had a Canon that I loved, prior to this, but it died a week before I went on my trip.  The zoom is terrific, even better than my last camera's.  While in NYC, I carried a small purse with me, and this camera fit very nicely.This camera does a good job in all lighting, and that was my main area of concern.  Once in a while, I will get a blurry picture, but it's because the setting needs to be changed.I am soooo happy with this camera!  My only wish is that I'd gotten the green one, but it was sold out.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Guzi
Reviews.Content: I bought it for someone else and she's happy, 12 megapixels, small package, Cannon, good price!

Reviews.Title: Did not even last six months
Reviews.Author: Autumnblu "Amy"
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for less than six months and used it lightly and the on off button stopped functioning. At first it would not shut off then not on. Just not well made. Cannons quality has really went down as this is the 2nd cannon I have bought in the last 3 years and had it stop functioning. The other was used a bit more and we had it a year. However this one was on a shelf most of the 6 months we had it.

Reviews.Title: Not so great if you need a point-n-shoot with an optical view-finder
Reviews.Author: V. C. Wald
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I thought it would produce better quality images than a camera phone (it does), its modest price, and it's portability. I selected it instead of numerous other Canon, Nikon, and other brands models, because it was the only one from a reputable maker with an optical view finder.Bad news: the viewfinder is highly inaccurate and does not frame the image/scene at all accurately. I've posted two photos of a pink poster, one framed through the viewfinder, in which the piece of paper appeared to be centered, and one framed through the monitor. The pic taken through the viewfinder is completely uncentered. In this case, what you see is NOT what you get.It's been handy and convenient to carry around, but it doesn't produce fine photographs by any means. Response/recycle time is extremely slow.With respect to battery life, I use eneloop rechargeable AAs and they last a long, long time between charges.ADDENDUM: I thought the images I uploaded would appear under "customer images" with the camera listing, but instead, you have to click on my name on this review, then on the images tab on my profile page, to see them. Sorry for the extra work!

Reviews.Title: Nice but slow
Reviews.Author: Smurfy gal
Reviews.Content: Overall, I like the camera.  The size is nice for carring around in a pocket. My main problem is the speed at which it takes the first picture.  When you first turn the camera on, it is like it has to warm up before it is ready to take the first picture, after that, the picture speed improves but isn't great.  If you are trying to capture pictures of kids or pets it is a bit challenging, especially if using a flash.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Denise C. Sarhan
Reviews.Content: after searching all around for good point and shoots under 200, i chose this one and am pretty happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for my 12yr old son.
Reviews.Author: Andrea Wehrenberg
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 12yr old son.  Easy to use.  Perfect size.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Canon P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: Polo Grande
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera 3 years ago, and had very high expectations.  They weren't realized.  I have been extremely disappointed.PROS: Structural integrity, rugged case.  No mechanical issues.  The camera produces decent adequate light pictures using auto mode, as long as the subject's within about 5-50'.  The fact that it takes AA batteries was a plus, although to get any decent life you have to use expensive lithium batteries.CONS: Obscure and complicated menus and adjustments in manual mode, low light capabilities are minimal, the zoom is absolutely atrocious and results in diffused, fuzzy, distorted scenes.  The movie mode is decent and the zoom seems to work sporadically during shooting- long distance movies are almost worthless.  Shooting at 8 or 12mp results in huge files but doesn't appear to upgrade the image at all.  Unacceptable lag time after flash pictures, even with new lithium batteries.I thought that because Canon primarily makes photographic and visual equipment that their cameras must be superb.  I was wrong.

Reviews.Title: really excited - really disappointed
Reviews.Author: CIM "mystery fan"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get my new camera and had researched it extensively before buying.  Wow, has this been a disappointment.  First it just stopped working within a month after I got it.  I sent it back to the manufacturer and they somehow fixed it.  Took it to England and got great pictures.  Came back and within a few months, the USB "door' got stuck open and hasn't closed since.  Then the batteries (AA) wouldn't charge the camera.  I am now able to take maybe three pictures on a new set of batteries and then the camera shuts down and says the batteries need to be replaced.  Put new batteries in again and the same thing happens after just a couple of shots.  The picture quality is great - when it lets you take a picture.  I am giving up on this camera and buying a new Nikon Coolpix.  Our old Coolpix is probably 7 years old, has been through an entire washload and still takes great pictures.  Can't wait to try out my new one.  Maybe I got a lemon, maybe not, but I am really disappointed in Canon and likely won't buy again.

Reviews.Title: Would get 1/2 star if possible
Reviews.Author: JediTempel
Reviews.Content: Absolutely hate this camera. Had a Powershot A95 that died 3 days before leaving for vacation, so I bought one of these so that I wouldn't have to spend alot of time learning to use it. What a disappointing replacement. The picture quality isn't any better than the A95 which only had 5 megapixels. It eats through batteries in about 20 minutes but when it says the batteries are low, you can turn it off and on again and it will continue on the same batteries for another 20 minutes then say they are low again so you can never tell how long they will actually last. Usually only for about 2 dozen pictures or about 2 or 3 minutes of video regardless. I go through handfuls of batteries at any event, day or night. The A95 did a 2 week trip to Europe on 8 batteries - and it took 4 at a time.Worse than the battery problem, the 1100 is unbelievably slooooow -at everything. The focus and shutter are so incredibly slow that people I've asked to take a picture for me actually get frustrated and use their own camera instead. Focus time is terrible and often poor when it finally does choose something to focus on. The delay in the shutter firing after you push the button is extremely long. Takes absolutely forever to be ready for repeat photos. The flash won't go off in low light so the shutter speed is way, way slow and pictures of anything other than a stationary object come out like crap. When the flash does go off, foreground items are super overexposed. Then the flash takes so long to recycle that whomever you are trying to take pictures of has already moved on because they figure you don't want any more pictures. If you're trying to get pictures of pets, they have to be sleeping or they just move before you can even get the shutter to go off. Hate the camera so much that I will be using my Christmas cash to purchase something else, even though this one isn't even a year old.

Reviews.Title: Returning this camera after 6 months of bad photos
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Barnes
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for over six months and am an expert in "amateur" digital photography, which I have been doing for 10 years.  This camera has continued to disappoint me, and has caused many memories that I will have to be reminded of with poor, blurry picture quality, and many lost photo opportunities due to the extremely limited battery life.  I have a good sense for setting up shots with good lighting, backgrounds, etc., and despite my continued efforts, this camera has a horrible ability to read and adjust for different lighting.  Many photos are too dark, or blurry as the camera adjusts for sunlight, artifical light, etc.  In addition, it takes blurry photos on action shots, and has an extremely slow shutter speed, so many photos of arms and feet!  The battery life is minimal, and at this point, almost non-existent.  Despite spending lots of $ on all types of batteries and inserting brand new batteries on several occassions, I have had the experience of being on a beautiful oceanside hike with my three children and having the camera tell me that there is no battery life, even thought the batteries are BRAND NEW.  I have finally reached my limit of missing shots, and capturing memories, and will be returning this camera to seek out a Kodak.

Reviews.Title: The famous lens error
Reviews.Author: Raymond S. BLAND "musicguy"
Reviews.Content: I really liked the camera. It was small.  Picture quality was generally good.  As in other reviews, I got a lens error after 6 months.  I tried all the suggested fixes but it is essentially trash.

Reviews.Title: Auto Focus Is problematic
Reviews.Author: William A. Fuller "The Old Bald Dude"
Reviews.Content: Camera was OK for what it is, BUT! After 2 months it refuses to focus on distant objects. Setting it to focus at infinity does no good. It still tries to autofocus and gets it wrong. Setting it to Landscape mode doesn't help either. Same deal. Makes very good pictures up close, but beyond 30 feet, the camera is totally useless. Canon wants me to send it to them at my expense and then they will decide whether or not it's a warranty repair. They are very vague about how quickly I might be able to get it back. The camera has not been subjected to any abuse. They don't give RMA numbers, and it's up to me to prove they get it. Really not a happy experience with their support people.

Reviews.Title: The Slow, Battery Hungry Canon
Reviews.Author: Lobo "Wearing Wool"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for about 8 or nine months. My last Canon finally died, but had been a good camera, quick to shoot, good digital pictures. The photos with this new camera are okay, though no improvement over my now dead 6 megapixel Canon. The problems are, first, the slow, slow, slow response with the shutter. Apparently it takes a long time to process the 12.1 megapixels. I like to shoot ski photos, and when the shutter is hit the picture is not taken for a beat or two. I try to lead the photo now, pressing before the optimal shot, which requires a prescience I really cannot claim. The first problem compounds the next, the lag between shots. You cannot take a quick series of pictures. It is very frustrating. Finally, the last Canon allowed me to recharge the battery. This Canon loves the batteries, I mean it eats them for lunch. I purchased rechargeable batteries, but it won't turn on with them. So, new batteries, and frequently. I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Spend your $$$ on more reliable product
Reviews.Author: Paul Richardson "adguy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon PowerShot A1100S through Amazon to replace a 2 year old 8 meg Nikon based on the positive review by consumer Reports.  The features and picture quality were no better than the 2 year old Nikon and the flash recovery was noticeably slower.  After 90 days the camera stopped working so I sent it to Canon under Warranty.  After a week I received an email stating that they were not going to honor the warranty due to moisture being found in the camera, I was shocked.  This camera had been kept in a case when not being used and had not been exposed to water other than a humid environment of the tropics.  My old Nikon has sent in excess of 90 days over the last 2 years going in and out of extremely humid environments, Cambodia, the Australian rain forest, Kauai, coastal BC without an issue.  This Canon is so poorly built that stopped working after a few days.  I figure I must have received a bad camera, which is why I sent it back but apparently their customer service department must see this issue frequently enough to claim it was mishandled to avoid taking responsibility for the poor quality.

Reviews.Title: canon power shot
Reviews.Author: Merrily R. Cohen "Merrily"
Reviews.Content: terrific camera. so easy to use. great pictures. never used digital camera before - pix look clear

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous pictures but...
Reviews.Author: R. Berry
Reviews.Content: ...this camera is a hard-core battery addict!  I can use it for "maybe" an hour and the batteries are dead! This happens with or without the view screen on.  I either need to get a ton of rechargeable batteries or a power cord!The pictures are beautiful!  I use the macro mode for taking pictures of jewelry and they come out crisp and clear.  I'm not a shutterbug by any means so it took me a while to figure out why they were coming out so HUGE.If the batteries would last longer I'd love this camera!

Reviews.Title: I'm not pleased - poor pic quality, construction not durable
Reviews.Author: SDM "PT-Guy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before Christmas 2009, and took lots of pictures during the colorful holidays.  I was not thrilled with the results - photos seemed dull, flat, and uninteresting.  Photos taken with my 6-year-old Sony were much better! Thought about returning the camera, but couldn't be bothered.  Wish I had - camera recently fell off a low end table, and the small plastic clasp for the battery/memory card compartment broke off. Now, because compartment doesn't close properly, camera doesn't always work. I have a good excuse to get a different camera - think I'll go back to Sony.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this one !!
Reviews.Author: happycamper "Pic glad"
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointd with this camera, being a canon and suposedly a 12 MP one, I had hoped that it would be a quality product, but the pictures I have been taking are very grainy, even when there is enough light, and when there isn't , well forget it !  I found that I could not zoom is at all as that made the quality unacceptable, I sent in some samples to Canon to show them what I meant, and they told that this was acceptable ! well, if that is acceptable, then don't bother with that camera !!

Reviews.Title: Belated Christmas Present
Reviews.Author: kmf "kmf"
Reviews.Content: Bought myself a belated Christmas present.  Love it.  Its light weight, compact and easy to use.  I carry in my purse and no I don't carry saddlebags or luggage.  Just wish I had picked up a case for it too.  Next time.

Reviews.Title: Good option for the money, small, but low zoom, avr quality
Reviews.Author: Sergio A. Bofill "Capitane"
Reviews.Content: Owned a A710is previously, this is not an upgrade, its a small brother. Smaller in zise, in flexibility, in luminosity of the lens, in zoom (I can't help but miss that outstanding 6x when using only this 4x) but smaller in price too.Start up is excelent, battery life Ok (nice to have AA std batteries), nice small zice.Nice to have colours to choose from!Ease of use is fine too. When compared with next level of the line, its obvious that the bridge is too big if you like photography.I would recomend it to teenagers or kids learning, it's perfect for that. Also, if you forgot your camera at home, buy it for that weekend and keep it for the kids! But if you've gone to a wonderfull place for pictures, or need speed, go for another.

Reviews.Title: Great P&S; Camera!
Reviews.Author: Christine Perkins
Reviews.Content: I had to borrow a friends camera for a trip to Palmyra NY, and this was the camera!! I LOVE it!! It had SOO many features.. so i knew it wasn't junk. I have a habit of reviewing all photos after they are taken. So i knew the photos were turning out GREAT! This camera also has a wonderful censor! This camera was perfect! I didn't use the flash much, but I got great photos!I am a professional photographer. Currently I own a Canon EOS 10D and 20D. This camera doesn't do well inside (Yellowish photos), but does GREAT with allot of lighting, and outside lighting.I am going to purchase this camera as my ONLY P&S.; I only use DSLR's, but they are bulky, and I want a camera I don't have to worry about, and can just have it in my purse, or diaper bag!his is a GREAT P&S; camera!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the product except the speed to take next one.
Reviews.Author: Ki Sung
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife for Christmas and she is very happy with all the feature except the time it takes another shot. I got this Cannon for her because she has high end Canon digital camera already and happy with Canon.  She says time between the shot is not fast to take another shot right away, so I gave the product 4 stars.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Not good for pictures in night.
Reviews.Author: Sathishkumar Chinnapaiyan "Satz"
Reviews.Content: This works good in the day light. but not in the night(yes, with flash), I tried to take some pictures on christmas eve, it was very bad, not even a single picture that i took were good. the image stabilization is bad, all the pictures are blur. I dint shake my hand but still it would not take a clear picture.  I bought this b'coz i had a canon 5 MP camera , I liked that. but this one didn't impress me.

Reviews.Title: Good for outdoors... I'ts an OK camera not an amazing one
Reviews.Author: Divaphoenix "divaphoenix"
Reviews.Content: I bought the New A 1100 IS because for being stupid I just gave away my A740 which I loved... I needed to have something portable and easy to carry around. So I decided I wanted to try this little one and take it with me to Italy because I didn't want to walk around with the big SLR.So I have to say is not bad if the weather conditions help with ntural light. On cloudy days the image quality is not the best, but in sunny days the pictures come out beautifully. The camera can be really slow in low light conditions and even that it has an image stabilization if you move a bit the image comes out blurry. It has no super macro setting like the A 470, but the macro setting is not bad. This camera eats the batteries really fast, it works better with rechargeable batteries, Other wise be ready to change batteries every 30 minutes. The indoors setting works ok. The view finder is good to have but if you use lots of zoom the picture comes out diferently than what you see through the view finder, so be careful with that.. I would say this is an OK camera, not an amazing camera.In general I was more happy with my A 470 I shoulded not give it away!!!

Reviews.Title: What a great camera!
Reviews.Author: P. Barnett
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my wife earlier this year. She is using it constantly and it takes great pictures.Pro's: Takes great pictures, even in low light. Super detail.Con's: It takes about a second for the focus to settle, If you just mash the button, you get an out of focus picture.I'd still rate it as an excellent camera since most of the competition also has this usability flaw.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Julie Thomas
Reviews.Content: I'm just an average picture taker, not too hung up on getting "just the right lighting" or whatever.  I just take pictures of our family for my scrapbook.  So this camera is perfect for me.  It's small enough to take everywhere, gives me great shots, is easy to use, and it's fairly inexpensive.  Works for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B Reed
Reviews.Content: My third Cannon camera and very pleased. I wanted the AA battery model which makes the camera slightingly larger but worth it to me. No problems with the camera or software.

Reviews.Title: hard to use for a rookie
Reviews.Author: M. Monaco "Sea Hag"
Reviews.Content: It's a lot of camera for a rookie. The words/pictures on the camera are very small, so study it and practice using it in advance of need-to-use. My ratings are based solely on my novice photographer position, NOT Canon engineering. It's hard to know whether to shut the camera off in order to save battery life, or keep it on till the timer shuts it off. Store batteries don't last long, so I'm looking for one of the longer lasting, new technology re-chargeable batteries. The 8GB memory card is a must. Don't know how to hook it up to the computer yet.Sanjay,I'm not sure how to get this to you, but I did read your response re. eneloop batteries and will be buying some. Thank you for your guidance as I am a putz when it comes to this stuff and don't have ANY money to blow. Again, much appreciated. I  got the La Crosse Technology BC-9009 AlphaPower Battery Charger (hope that was smart buy). As time permits, I will continue to learn to use my Canon 1100.  Sea Hag

Reviews.Title: Great pics if you have gentle hands!
Reviews.Author: Jerrie R. Anthony "Jerrie Anthony"
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely easy to use, takes great pictures and fits in very small purses, it's exactly what I was looking for HOWEVER I personally felt the need to return it due to it's seemingly fragile structure, I am extremely clutzy and have dropped many a camera, so I didn't think this one would hold up well with ME!!!  It's great for everyone else!

Reviews.Title: TWICE!!! Lens Error => needs service = lousy camera
Reviews.Author: D W "D W"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE. => Had to send the camera to Canon for service over the Christmas holiday (thankfully had another camera for Christmas morning).  Received it after service on Jan 2nd.  Have used gingerly for 3 weeks and have received Lens Error message again so will require service.  COMPLETE PIECE OF JUNK!  Buy at your own risk, but I don't know why you would. <=I have owned 4 Canon cameras.  This is the worst one by far.  Purchased it on 11/12 and as of 12/21 there is a 'lens error' so we need to get it serviced.  We purchased this one as the last Canon we had started to have issues with internal flash pictures.  Hopefully we can use it successfully Christmas morning.  Thanks a lot Canon for making a lousy camera as we might not have a decent one to take pictures of our kids.-Picture quality is only average.-Video quality is below average especially if you are moving.  I am not sure if  there are image stabilizers in other cameras that are not in this one.-The focus assistance does not always work properly as it is difficult to align the 'green box' guide onto the items requiring focus.-Our last camera had a swivel screen and this one does not so it is easily scratched.-Photo speed is extremely slow.  Not sure if this is a function of the memory card or not, but our last camera was much faster.I highly suggest you do not buy this camera.  We bought it based on its Consumer Reports' ratings, but it is a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Must have gotten a lemon
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: This camera is the third Canon I have owned.  The quality of photos is simply terrible.  Bought for Christmas, used in February to take photos of new granddaughter while in California and lost over half of photos because they were blurry, distorted, too dark etc. Did not discover this until my daughter downloaded some of my shots to her computer and we discovered how bad they were.  Extremely disappointed to have lost so many irreplaceable photos.  I could not return to Amazon because 30 days had elapsed, so contacted Canon customer  service by email.  They sent canned responses outlining all the things a novice camera user should do.  Tried to explain I knew what I was doing (having taken thousands of photos with other Canon cameras)that the camera was defective.  They sent another canned response suggesting I use a tripod to take my photos.  Use a tripod to catch action shots of a 6 month old baby??? Use a tripod to take candid shots while sightseeing?? Use a tripod to take photos with a "point and shoot" camera??  Get real.  Finally called customer service and was told to send to repair location in Illinois, at my expense. After vigorously complaining about that to the representative on the phone. Remember the camera was only 3 months old.  They agreed to pay for shipping and I sent off to be repaired.  The repair service received the camera on a Friday and shipped it back to me on the same Friday.  They stated that the repair was not a "covered warranty repair, but would repair it at no cost to me as a courtesy".  The camera is performing exactly as it did before sending to "repair" and I am stuck with what I think is a lemon.  I will never again purchase a canon camera because if it ever needs repair or service, you are just "tuff out of luck".  I advised customer service that the camera was still not performing as it should and have received no response from them.Can not believe I was treated so poorly by Canon over a camera that was only three months old.

Reviews.Title: No Manual
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my remarks by first noting the Canon A1100 IS  is the first digital camera I have owned or used.  I researched carefully, I thought, before I purchased it but am somewhat dissatisfied.  First it came without a printed owner's manual.  The manual provided was on CD Rom.  Though it was easy enough to install the software on our computer, running back and forth trying to learn how to use the camera and take pictures was to say the least "trying".  I wasn't about to print a 130 page manual and sent an e-mail to Canon complaining about it.  They agreed to send me a manual - in six weeks (I'm still waiting on it). Shortly after this exchange Canon sent me an e-mail requesting I rate their customer service.  I informed them I was dissatisfied, that the camera was sent without a printed manual and the prospect of waiting six weeks was unsatisfactory; they sent me a manual consisting of 130  8x11 pages stapled together stamped "copy" on every page frustrating me further.  Fortunately I found a third party vender who sells manuals for Canon and other camera manufacturers and purchased a spiral bound 5x8 manual for less than $20.00.  I also find battery life very short and limiting. The LCD screen is impossible to see in any non-shaded outdoor area. Fortunately it has an optical view finder.  I also noted in reading the manual I have that the camera does not have a true manual mode. If you put in settings the camera doesn't agree with it overrides them.

Reviews.Title: Terrible pictures with zoom
Reviews.Author: Grams "Grams Photo Buff"
Reviews.Content: I have always had Canon cameras and when I bought this  one I expected the quality to be just as good. If I use the zoom on a tripod the pictures are blurry and pixalated. I bought it to take close ups of my jewelry for my business. I used a tripod and a photo box and the quality was still horrible. I also love to take photos of sun rises and sun sets and if I use the zoom the pictures never turn out.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Qui N. Nguyen "cowboy"
Reviews.Content: I bought a SD1100 a year ago and very happy with it. This A1100 is a big disappointment. Picture quality is poor even at 12MP. When transfer to the computer for a larger view, all the grain shows up even with the flash. Second, it's TOOOO SLOOOOW, 3-5 seconds between each shot regardless of which resolution chosen: 1M, 2M 3M, etc. These shots were taken with the included 128MB SD card so one can rule out the card incompatibility. Battery life is terrible. After taking only around 20 pictures using the alkaline Panasonic batteries that came with the camera, the low battery indicator started flashing.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery door cover latch
Reviews.Author: G. Reuland
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine, just a little slow to focus and take picture. The latch on the battery door broke, small plastic tab which keeps the door shut.  I replaced it once but it broke again. Not a good design.Battery life is fair, doesn't seem to like NiMh batteries, they don't last long. Perhaps they have a slightly lower voltage and the camera needs the full volts of alkaline batteries to function well.

Reviews.Title: Was great for 2 weeks...then...
Reviews.Author: Bryan Stableford
Reviews.Content: This was my first digital camera.  After careful research, I bought this camera on sale at a local big box store...not Amazon.  In the operating manual it states that it will take a couple hundred pictures on a fresh set of batteries.  Well, I only got about 60-70, but that is OK I never take that many pictures at one time anyway. Suddenly, after only 2 weeks the camera started to shut down after only 5 or 10 pictures.  Thinking that it was the rechargeable batteries, I put in a fresh set of energizers.  SAME THING...I get the "replace batteries message"  The batteries are fine according to my high quality battery tester.  Now I only get 2-3 shots before the camera shuts down. I ended up buying the wall adapter on ebay just so that I can take pictures for my listings.  Can't do much else with this camera when you have a cord attached to it and that cord is plugged into the wall. I emailed Canon 3 times and got ZERO replies back from them.  Well, Canon got my $140, but that is the last penny they're ever get from me. Stay away from this camera, and you might consider staying away from Canon as well.

Reviews.Title: "lens error, restart camera"
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: I have the Canon Powershot A1100 IS. I was SO excited. Yesterday it was working fine, and yesterday afternoon the lens would not open and I got my quoted message. I am heartsick and I am lost without a camera, used to taking photos nearly every day. A nice long e-mail from Canon telling me what to try (that sounded rather like a joke) and then how to send it in, etc. Minimumm charge $90. Sigh. I can't afford it. I did a search online and this appears to be a huge problem. That seems ridiculous to me.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error Unhappiness
Reviews.Author: Nettie8008 "nettie8008"
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to get this camera as an upgrade to my old Powershot.  Unfortunately, after a few months of use the lens jammed for no explicable reason and it won't open.  In trying to get it fixed I found that I have to send the camera away and it's $60 just to look at it and then the cost of the repair on top of it.This shows a defect in this camera - it should have lasted a whole lot longer than that for the price.  Canon needs to fix this.  My old camera still works really well and I had to go back to that one!

Reviews.Title: Good Riddance
Reviews.Author: L. Christensen
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 2 years now. It stopped working from a lens error and can't be repaired cheaply and I'm so glad for an excuse to get a new better camera!! Let me explain I am a shutter happy mama who likes to document life's journey. I'm not a professional but I love to take pictures--lots of them-- and I want them to turn out well! I've taken around 3000 photos of kids, recitals, reunions, beach trips, mountains, etc. Some of my pictures turned out great but I was more often FRUSTRATED with the results. I often had to take several shots just to get one clear one. Pictures had a lot of shadows which other cameras have the ability to erase. Low light pictures never turned out. I finally learned if I was indoor on an evening to just forget about taking a picture--flash or no flash. Shudder speed was way too slow for me. I missed countless great photo ops because the photo snapped too late.Also this SUCKED battery life like there was no tomorrow. I have easily spent more on AA batteries (sometimes lithium sometimes regular) than I paid for the camera.No tears from me now that my camera has died. Good riddance!I could only recommend this for a KID/TEEN --one who has a hefty enough allowance to buy lots of batteries.

Reviews.Title: don't expect this to last more than 18 mos
Reviews.Author: echaney
Reviews.Content: Poorly made camera.  Several family members bought the same camera at the same time, and we are all suffering with them breaking, eating through batteries, and functioning slowly.  We have owned Canons for a long, long time.  Canon, shame on you for such poor quality!

Reviews.Title: camera broke after 1-1/2 year
Reviews.Author: Gail Turner
Reviews.Content: Power shot canon camera A1100IS broke after 1-1/2 year.  That is not good enough forme to want to buy any more Canon's from Amazon in the future.  Camera was handled with carenever dropped.  Amazon should check this out because for me this reflects on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: "Lens Error, Restart" Alert
Reviews.Author: D. Scott
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera because we have had good luck with the AA powered Canons at work and I needed a camera for when the cell phone camera wasn't enough and film wasn't called for. I used it three times in 11 months. While every environment has some dust and dirt in it, I never used or stored this device anywhere harsh. On the forth attempted use it locked up with the "Lens Error, Restart" problem.My Canon film SLR from the 70's still works when I used it every couple of years so I can say they used to know how to make cameras well. Now, all I can say is I won't be buying another Canon and I will avoid using them at work. The world is not a clean room and I need gear I can count on.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Dora L Crawford
Reviews.Content: This camera is light weight and easy to use.  I took some great pictures on our trip to Alaska.

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC CAMERA
Reviews.Author: TERRY
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A GREAT CAMERA. THE ZOOM IS EXCELLENT AND THE SETTINGS ARE SO EASY. THIS IS THE BEST CAMERA I HAVE PURCHASED EVER. RECOMMEND THIS HIGHLY ESPECIALLY IF YOU WANT SIMPLE, GREAT PICTURES AND THE STABILIZATION IS EXCELLENT.

Reviews.Title: not so small, eats bateries
Reviews.Author: F. Whitby
Reviews.Content: This is not a great camera.  The use of AA batteries is a bad idea.  This thing just consumes batteries at an alarming rate.  This camera is not so tiny, either.  Otherwise the camera works fine, nothing special.  I cannot recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Saniga
Reviews.Content: I bought the green one because it was cheapest.  Now I like the green!  It has a viewfinder and I use it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Power Shot A1100 is
Reviews.Author: Daphne Wilson
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera.  Had one before but gave to my son after grandson was born so I bought myself another one.  I liked that I could make little videos with it.  Great camera..Great photos!Dealer was prompt with shipping as well!!

Reviews.Title: A BIG IMPROVEMENT OVER AN ALREADY GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Stanley J. Friesenhahn
Reviews.Content: THIS SMALLER VERSION VERSION OF THE POWER SHOT IS EASIER TO USE LARGELY BECAUSE THE ANNOYING "MODE" SWITCH ON THE PREVIOUS MODEL HAS BEEN ELIMINATED.  THE ONLY CRITICISM I HAVE IS THAT THE "ON" BUTTON IS RECESSED A LITTLE TOO MUCH, MAKING IT SOMEWHAT DIFFICULT TO OPERATE.  ALSO THE PRINTED DOCUMENTATION SUPPLIED IS LACKING IN DETAIL.  AN EXTENSIVE DESCRIPTION IS AVAILABLE ON LINE, BUT UNFORTUNATELY IT IS NOT IN PDF FORMAT, THUS MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO PRINT.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1100IS
Reviews.Author: K. Armstrong
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  The pictures are sharp.  It is easy to use.  It is easy on batteries.  I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: John E. Douglas "Frenchie"
Reviews.Content: Small viewfinder, incamera menu a bit confusing to use.  When received froms eller, the screen had a small scratch.  Seller notified of this deffect.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Abid Hasan Mujtaba
Reviews.Content: There is no beating a Canon camera. I bought a crappy GE a few years ago and not for much less. My new Powershot has taught me how silly that idea was. Love my new camera. It feels solid but light and takes fantastic pictures.

Reviews.Title: Paid for NEW, got USED.
Reviews.Author: George L. Martin
Reviews.Content: I placed an order 3/20/10 and received 3/29/10.  I have used the camera about 4 weeks now. I paid for a new camera.  When I opened the package, it appeared to be packed as new.  When I unwrapped the camera itself, I noticed 2 small scratches on the LCD.  I knew at that time the camera was actually used.  I put the camera through all situations I would ever need it to do.  It performed fine and takes great pics.  It is reasonably user friendly.  I really like the view finder because the LCD is so hard to see on a bright sunny day.  I decided to keep it rather than going through the aggravation of the return process.  I returned items 2 times before and have decided for me, it is not worth the aggravation to save a few bucks.  Unfortunately, this is my last online order.

Reviews.Title: No complaints
Reviews.Author: Marionita Mcgee "Micki McGee"
Reviews.Content: So far this camera has been very efficient.  It's fairly easy to use and my pictures have been good.  I'm no professional, but for recreational use it does just fine.

Reviews.Title: my cam
Reviews.Author: K. Harper
Reviews.Content: Firstly I'm not a professional photographer as may be able to tell from my choice of purchase, therefore the quality of pics this camera produces are just fine for me. I'm coming from a Kodak easyshare 6.3 megapix that got broken.I hardly even use the darn thing but i have it when i need it and it does a great job. Get the silver, it's a better build quality (lol)

Reviews.Title: Good enough!
Reviews.Author: Asdrubal Sanabria "Asdrúbal Sanabria S."
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time that I purchase this camera, same model, for my father, uncle, and myself.  All of us are very satisfied with this high quality product from CANON.  I have had other models from this brand and still been an excellent product to consider in digital cameras over his competitors.The only thing that I want to see more realible in Canon cameras are the night vision quality to see what are you taking in the dark.

Reviews.Title: Powershot A1100IS
Reviews.Author: JerDog

Reviews.Title: WORKS FOR ME.
Reviews.Author: MMPEE
Reviews.Content: I just needed a small digital camera to take quick snapshots that I could then email to friends and family.  This camera works fine for my purposes.  I am not planning on creating art with my snapshots.  I have not had any issues with battery life so far.  It is easy to plug into my Mac and transfer the pictures and then prep them for email with one click of a button.  I tried using a friends older camera this past week.  It was hard to hold steady and get a non-blurry picture.  This Canon has image stabilization and I have not had even one blurry picture due to hands moving when I press the button.  The pictures look clean and clear and in focus.  I did a lot of research and this Canon was highly recommended in this price range. I would recommend this camera to a friend who was looking for a camera for the same purposes as I.  My only complaint is that there seem to be a lot ofsymbols and functions of the camera that are not fully explained in the paper user manual that came with the product.  As I use the camera more and more I will have to check and see if there is any digital manual that came with the camera that explains what all these various symbols, etc. stand for and how to use them properly.  But as for just pointing and shooting snap shots, it was easy to get started.  This is my first digital camera.Previously I took slides and negatives with a Canon FTb which I still have, but don't use much anymore.  It's quicker and simpler to use the digital camera for snapshots to email to family than shoot, develop, print and snail mail pictures.

Reviews.Title: Five Star Camera...with a fatal flaw for this user
Reviews.Author: Marshall Emm
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera but I had to return it because of a "non-standard" USB interface in the camera and an unacceptable work-around suggested by Canon's tech support.  They wasted about an hour of my time before getting to that point!I've used professional Canon film cameras, and this point'n'shoot would have been perfect for my requirements if I could simply have got the pictures off it and into my computer. Considering the price, I have to give the camera 5 stars as a camera, but zero stars as a "removable storage device."I have access to 6 computers, but could only connect the camera to one of them, which happens to be the least suitable for any number of reasons. Because the USB interface defines itself as an imaging device, it can only be plugged into machines running Windows XP-SP2 or later. I could do that on one of my machines, which has USB 1.0 and is therefore too slow to be practical.  The other machine has a multi-function printer/fax/scanner attached, and apparently the camera is not happy if another imaging device is already installed. After playing around with settings, unplugging the MFC, rebooting, etc, Canon's tech suggested that I remove the card from the camera and plug it into the card reader.  Well, guess what...  the card is SDHC and cannot be read by an older SD card reader.Every other digital camera that I use or have used for the last ten years will plug straight into the USB port and appear on the drive list (so will my cellphones!). Without the device conflict, that's what happens with the PowerShot, and the "advanced features" available in the software, related to operation of an "imaging device" can be ignored. So in effect the conflict which relates only to the higher level features of the interface, makes the lower level connectivity impossible.I reluctantly returned the camera, but I have had difficulty in finding anything close outside the Canon brand-- major problem being a separate optical viewfinder. Not even the PowerShot's display is usable in outside daylight conditions.  And I have also found more recently that an external card reader can be had for less than $20.  I shouldn't HAVE to do that, but I am seriously thinking of doing it on the grounds that it is no more inconvenient than connecting the USB cable.

Reviews.Title: Purchased Saturday night, returned Sunday morning...
Reviews.Author: Vince A.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera thinking that I would save a few dollars from the Canon SD780 and others in the $200 price range.  I heard that Canon's generally took great pictures (as I normally have bought Sony's, but I wanted a SD card camera) and I thought that a 12MB camera for less than $150 without bells and whistles would do the trick. WRONG!!I took the camera into a dimly lit restaurant immediately after purchasing and decided to take some pictures.  I was extremely shocked when I saw how washed out and muted the pictures were on the camera.  My girlfriend had her Sony Cybershot (5mb) camera with her and we took similar pictures on Auto mode of both cameras and the older Sony clearly outperformed the Canon A1100.  Additionally, the zoom rocker felt very unresponsive/sluggish when picking a zoom position.Long story short, I took the camera back today (12 hrs later) and purchased a Fuji F72 which has a 10X Optical Zoom and much sturdier/slimmer design for $70 more.  The old saying is you get what you pay for.  I feel that I got robbed by Canon for performance  that would have been better from a disposable and I'm anxious to see the results of the Fuji for getting a slim camera (with excellent reviews on the net and youtube) with more than twice the zoom of cameras in the same price range.Strongly would recommend staying away from this camera...

Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my granddaughter - age 11 - for Christmas.  She was able to use the camera right away and was taking pictures with great ease.  The quality of the photos was good to above average.  Functionality was terrific and she was able to use the camera with ease.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a good camera and is not looking for a camera that is for a pro.

Started using it right from the box.  You can set it to totally automatic or adjust settings to what you desire based on what you are doing.  I was finally able to get some amazing shots of our Christmas tree lights that came out soooooooo perfect.If you are not adept at electronics or photography, it has an ""EASY"" mode that does everything for you....If you want a no frills cam for a good price...I absolutely encourage it....

Reviews.Title: Don't Bump The Lens!!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Steel
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera new.  Appeared to be a nice little camera.  While I was at a Birthday Party, the camera was sitting on a table and tipped over on it lens.  The camera then displayed a "Lens Error Restart" message.  I kept powering it on and off and the lens would move in and out and then redisplay the message.  I tried to push in the lens while it was retracting and hoping that it would assist, and then the outer cover pops off....Ughhh!  I was shocked!  I sent it to the Canon Warranty Factory and they claimed that I had damaged it since the cheap plastic outer cover was off.  They wanted to charge me $100 to get it fixed.  I refused and had them mail it back.  By a more durable camera...like the Kodak C190, or Sony model.  I will not be buying another Canon!!

Reviews.Title: Canon A1100IS - don't buy it!
Reviews.Author: OLG "OLG"
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to France with this camera. I have purchased Canon cameras in the past and all except for a couple of others I purchased a few years ago, they have been of high quality, but I was horrified to see haloing around the light portions of the pictures in the resulting photographs (in the sky around trees for example) and a general lack of sharpness. The quality is terrible! I am an "art" photographer and have used other point and shoots in the past in my "serious work," but the quality of this one is exceptionally bad. By my experience with the last few Canon cameras that I have bought, Canon has sunk to the lowest quality, at least on their mid-range point and shoot cameras.  It also eats batteries.  I was not even able to get through a complete day on a standard set of batteries in this camera, mind you with over average shooting. I would not recommend this camera, nor with past purchases Canons in general if this is what they have come to.

Reviews.Title: I just wish these would keep working for more than 1 year
Reviews.Author: Paul van Gulick
Reviews.Content: I have owned two of these - first an A60, and then an A85.  Each has given about 1 year of reliable service and then begun to fail.  First the shutter stops closing, then the lcd display starts twitching, and then finally the pictures are a smear.  The A60 actually started acting up within 6 months, so I sent it in for repairs and got another 6 months out of it.  The second ultimately lasted about a year and a half.I use(d to use) these cameras to take pictures for structural engineering reports - and needed them about twice per week.  I have never dropped either one and I have always kept them in a case when not in use - so they have had a fairly easy life.The powershots really are lovely to use and give great pictures, but I've decided not to purchase a third.

Unfortunately the camera only works in daylight.  The flash is defective. Reviews.Content: I will typically get 10-15 shots on digital camera batteries.  I get 2-3 shots with regular batteries.  Any review of the features/capabilities of this unit are not very relevant give that the battery life renders the camera virtually useless.  Of the few pictures I have been able to take, they are moderate quality.  I have a 4MP Olympus that provides better results.I do not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Completely pointless
Reviews.Author: Bird That Flew
Reviews.Content: To say thing thing eats batteries is the understatement of the year.  I went through a brand new package of AA batteries - four of them - taking photos during a 1 hour presentation.  Another time, taking a total of 40 photos in the course of approximately 2 hours (not leaving the camera on during the whole time, of course) took 6 brand-new batteries.  You'll be okay for a few minutes, then get a low battery warning, then it will tell you your batteries are dead and will die.  The awesome thing is, your batteries aren't dead - at least, mine weren't.  The same batteries that my camera told me were dead have been powering my TV remote for a matter of months.Even if it weren't for that issue, the recovery time in between photos takes foooooreverrrrr.  It drives me insane to the point where I don't even want to use it - that is, if I COULD use it.I despise this camera.  The only thing going for it is its pretty mint green color.

Reviews.Title: and on the seventh day...
Reviews.Author: Johanna
Reviews.Content: The camera worked great for 6 days.  My daughter took some nice pictures, especially with macro shots.  And on the seventh day (while on vacation, of course), the camera started crapping out.  Although it was able to snap a picture, it could do no more than that.It stopped zooming (the zoom button would not move).  We could no longer view other pix that were on the disk -- only the last pic taken.  The menu became inaccessible, so you could not change the settings.Funny thing:  The camera is classified as a "point and shoot."  Well, that's exactly what it did.  Nothing else.  I opted to return it.  We need more working features.Be wary of this camera!
